column4: >Let's face it: you aren't quite happy with the music from your mobile phone, are you? You bought a more expensive earphone set, only to be disappointed by marginal quality improvements. It turns out that the reason to this is down to the limited audio processing capabilities inside your phone. We at Zorloo are tired of the limitations of the current earphone capabilities.

>Because of this, we designed the Aero Digital Earphones. Digital earphones are earphones that bypass the standard device audio processing unit, and recreate HiFi quality music directly through the earphone set itself via a built-in DAC (Digital to Analog Converter). Aero Digital Earphone eliminates the bottleneck that the standard processing method experiences and faithfully reproduces your music that comes out of your earphones and into your ears. With this built-in DAC and amplifier, they are not just earphones. It is a complete HiFi system. Join the revolution and free your music!

column1: We, Andy Ho and J.W. Cha, founded Zorloo at Nov-2014. We both previously worked in the consumer electronics industry and decided to work on something new and more exciting. We love music and believe it would be great if we can create something affordable to improve the mobile audio experience.

We picked USB-Audio technology to bypass your phones internal audio circuitry which is also the bottleneck. Mobility, performance and usability are our priorities. Aero is something we have been targeting from day one. Our goal is to make the Aero experience pleasing to users, with a small size and no battery, yet outputs an amazing sound!

During this journey, we have launched 2 successful crowdfunding campaigns, 'Z:ero - World's First Digital Earphone' and 'ZuperDAC - The Portable HiFi Music USB-DAC', both in 2015. These 2 products are already in production, have been delivered to our backers and are available at our online store and different marketplaces (see Z:ero and ZuperDAC reviews here). We are not however stopping at this, but rather pushing further until we reach perfection.

Aero is our ultimate goal to deliver a fully tuned earphone with an unmatched price performance. We have been pouring all our resource and investment into Aero Digital Earphone. We are now almost there and need your support to make this happen.

column7: >nlike traditional earphones getting analog signal from the 3.5mm audio jack, Aero receives digital audio data from Lightning or USB port. It is equipped with the best-of-the-class ESS SABRE 9018Q2C audio DAC with an integrated headphone amplifier. You can now carry a complete HiFi audio system in your palm!

column4: >Aero support 3 different interface standards. We have versions for:

column2: >USB-C connector for Android Phone/Tablet, Windows PC/Tablet, Win-10 Mobile Phone and Apple Macbook 12"".

column4: >Every musician and artist tries to share their inspiration and work with you. We make sure every detail is retained and faithfully reproduced. There is no guess work needed, it is simply just crystal clear audio playback. Aero digital earphone enable new ways for you to discover music, allowing you to hear the small parts and sounds you never noticed before.

>Aero is the result of careful planning and research. We work with our earphone manufacturer to develop a specially designed custom driver module to deliver the best matched performance with our DAC and amplifier. The driver module is a removable part housed in a high quality aluminum chassis. We used a 14.8mm driver to deliver full range response and to make sure not a single tiny detail is missed. The dynamic coil design is controlled by specially tailored Neodymium magnetics to ensure quick and fast response.

>Aero is based on a modular design concept with HearSwap detachable driver modules. In short, that means you can interchange the driver modules to enjoy different listening experiences. At our initial launch, we have so far created three types of modules with dedicated tuning modes: Acoustic, Euphoric and Nostalgic.
>Acoustic driver module (Matte Silver/Gun-Metal color) is optimized to deliver an all-rounded linear. It comes standard with the Aero earphone.
>Euphoric driver module (Glossy Gold color) adds more emphasis on bass and dynamics. It is an option sold separately.
>Nostalgic driver module (Matte Copper color) has a warm sound signature. It is an option sold separately.

>Aero is battery free and is light weight to conveniently carry around. They use a contoured design, with tangle-free wiring that wraps comfortably and securely behind your ears. There is not much new compared to the original Z:ero earphones regarding the controls. It uses the same volume and play/pause buttons conveniently situated on the control box. It is simply a case of plug and play with awesome sound!

>We know that you will love to carry Aero around with you. Because of this, we include a convenient carrying pouch that comes with every Aero earphone set. It is just the right size to store Aero and is super easy to carry around. Aero is also pre-configured with a pair of ComplyFoam T500 isolation premium eartips to add extra comfort and isolation to your private enjoyment. There are three additional pairs of silicon gel eartips included for your selection.
>* We will send you an email survey for your selection.

>The shipping fee will be added when you select your country at the perk contribution checkout. We will ship Aero using your country's postal service. Tax and duties are not included. We will email you a shipment notification and your tracking number when we initiate the delivery.
>We strongly suggest you to add

column4: >If you like the Zorloo Aero Digital Earphones, why not share the news with your friends and family on your social media accounts using the Indiegogo share tools?  If you send your Aero campaign link to your friends and they contribute, you will be able to get the following rewards:
>Get 20% off your perk if you refer 4 contributors
>Get a free Aero if you refer 10 contributors

column1: Login to your Indiegogo account. For Desktop browser, please press the link button at the left hand side of the campaign video at the top. It will create a unique link for you (the last 7 digits shown at the picture below is an example only, your own number will be different) and please use this to send to your friends (or simply use the Facebook, Twitter, Email button directly). That is what we will use to determine how many contributors you have referred.

If you are using the Indiegogo app at your mobile phone, you can use the share button to share your link to other social media applications directly. See below picture that shows the share button at iPhone and Android versions.
Be our team and let more people know about the Aero campaign, share it on Faceback, Twitter, Instagram, blogs, newsgroup, forums and other sites!

column4: >Numbers don't tell the whole story, get an Aero digital earphone and try out yourself to feel the difference!
>1. Is Aero for Lightning version certified by Apple?

column1: Aero is undergoing MFi certification at Apple right now. Our manufacturing factory is MFi certified so we will start the production once the certification is completed.
2. Does Aero for Micro-USB version work with all Android phones?

Due to fragmentation of Android and the unmanageable amount of different models, we are not able to guarantee the compatibility for all Android phones. We have tested with the following phones and they all work without any problem:

column10: Samsung Galaxy S3, S4, S5, S6, S6 Edge
column12: Sony Xperia M Dual, Sony Xperia Z1, Z2, Z3, Z5

column1: 3. Does Aero for USB-C version work with all Android phones?
Mobile phone with USB-C is quite new and we are not able to test all available phones in the market. We have tested Aero with Nexus 5X, 6P
4. Does Aero for USB-C version work with Apple Macbook 12""?
Yes, it is plug and play compatible.
5. Does Aero work with Windows Mobile Phone?
Windows 10 mobile is the first Windows version to support USB Audio and should work (but not for the older versions).
6. Can I use Aero with my PC/Mac and any driver required?

Aero Micro-USB and USB-C versions can both be used with PC/Mac if they have the corresponding ports. You may need a USB adapter for conversion if you only have the USB type-A port (the big one). Windows and OSX both have native USB Audio Class 1 support and there is no need for driver installation.
No, Aero is designed to optimize on the music listening experience and we don't want any additional microphone circuitry to interfere.
8. How does that compare with Bluetooth which is also digital?

Bluetooth is a wireless technology. The major problem is its bandwidth limitation. It cannot support native CD quality PCM audio streaming and requires audio compression to compensate. Aero digital earphone support 48kHz 24-bit (better than CD 44.1kHz 16-bit) source materials without any compromise on audio performance.
9. I am using Z:ero and feel great with it, should I upgrade?

Aero improves over Z:ero in a number of ways. It uses ESS SABRE 9018Q2C DAC+AMP which is a higher performance part over Wolfson DAC+AMP used in Z:ero. The Aero earphone driver (14.8mm) is a fully custom design developed to match with the whole system. We used a detachable scheme and provide different driver options for you to experiment. We used tangle-free cables and all connectors are molded in house. The overall reliability and durable are further improved. Aero enables more ways for you to enjoy music.

column2: >We have completed the Aero design and have fully working samples for all 3 versions. For the past 10 months, we have been working with our PCB and earphone factories to develop and verify our PCBA and earphone drivers. Our Aero iPhone version is undergoing Apple MFi certification right now. We already have all tooling done and will prepare materials for the production soon.

column1: Getting into smooth production is always a challenge but it is also a fun exercise to learn new tricks. We have already manufactured 2 products (Z:ero and ZuperDAC) and are confident to produce Aero and deliver to you.

","Let's face it: you aren't quite happy with the music from your mobile phone, are you? You bought a more expensive earphone set, only to be disappointed by marginal quality improvements. It turns out that the reason to this is down to the limited audio processing capabilities inside your phone. We at Zorloo are tired of the limitations of the current earphone capabilities.

Because of this, we designed the Aero Digital Earphones. Digital earphones are earphones that bypass the standard device audio processing unit, and recreate HiFi quality music directly through the earphone set itself via a built-in DAC (Digital to Analog Converter). Aero Digital Earphone eliminates the bottleneck that the standard processing method experiences and faithfully reproduces your music that comes out of your earphones and into your ears. With this built-in DAC and amplifier, they are not just earphones. It is a complete HiFi system. Join the revolution and free your music!

We, Andy Ho and J.W. Cha, founded Zorloo at Nov-2014. We both previously worked in the consumer electronics industry and decided to work on something new and more exciting. We love music and believe it would be great if we can create something affordable to improve the mobile audio experience.

We picked USB-Audio technology to bypass your phones internal audio circuitry which is also the bottleneck. Mobility, performance and usability are our priorities. Aero is something we have been targeting from day one. Our goal is to make the Aero experience pleasing to users, with a small size and no battery, yet outputs an amazing sound!

During this journey, we have launched 2 successful crowdfunding campaigns, 'Z:ero - World's First Digital Earphone' and 'ZuperDAC - The Portable HiFi Music USB-DAC', both in 2015. These 2 products are already in production, have been delivered to our backers and are available at our online store and different marketplaces (see Z:ero and ZuperDAC reviews here). We are not however stopping at this, but rather pushing further until we reach perfection.

Aero is our ultimate goal to deliver a fully tuned earphone with an unmatched price performance. We have been pouring all our resource and investment into Aero Digital Earphone. We are now almost there and need your support to make this happen.

Unlike traditional earphones getting analog signal from the 3.5mm audio jack, Aero receives digital audio data from Lightning or USB port. It is equipped with the best-of-the-class ESS SABRE 9018Q2C audio DAC with an integrated headphone amplifier. You can now carry a complete HiFi audio system in your palm!
Aero support 3 different interface standards. We have versions for:
The Apple iPhone/iPad via Lightning connector,
Android phones via the Micro-USB connector.
USB-C connector for Android Phone/Tablet, Windows PC/Tablet, Win-10 Mobile Phone and Apple Macbook 12"".
* See FAQ for phones we tested for compatibility.

Every musician and artist tries to share their inspiration and work with you. We make sure every detail is retained and faithfully reproduced. There is no guess work needed, it is simply just crystal clear audio playback. Aero digital earphone enable new ways for you to discover music, allowing you to hear the small parts and sounds you never noticed before.

Aero is the result of careful planning and research. We work with our earphone manufacturer to develop a specially designed custom driver module to deliver the best matched performance with our DAC and amplifier. The driver module is a removable part housed in a high quality aluminum chassis. We used a 14.8mm driver to deliver full range response and to make sure not a single tiny detail is missed. The dynamic coil design is controlled by specially tailored Neodymium magnetics to ensure quick and fast response.

Aero is based on a modular design concept with HearSwap detachable driver modules. In short, that means you can interchange the driver modules to enjoy different listening experiences. At our initial launch, we have so far created three types of modules with dedicated tuning modes: Acoustic, Euphoric and Nostalgic.
Acoustic driver module (Matte Silver/Gun-Metal color) is optimized to deliver an all-rounded linear. It comes standard with the Aero earphone.
Euphoric driver module (Glossy Gold color) adds more emphasis on bass and dynamics. It is an option sold separately.
Nostalgic driver module (Matte Copper color) has a warm sound signature. It is an option sold separately.

Aero is battery free and is light weight to conveniently carry around. They use a contoured design, with tangle-free wiring that wraps comfortably and securely behind your ears. There is not much new compared to the original Z:ero earphones regarding the controls. It uses the same volume and play/pause buttons conveniently situated on the control box. It is simply a case of plug and play with awesome sound!

We know that you will love to carry Aero around with you. Because of this, we include a convenient carrying pouch that comes with every Aero earphone set. It is just the right size to store Aero and is super easy to carry around. Aero is also pre-configured with a pair of ComplyFoam T500 isolation premium eartips to add extra comfort and isolation to your private enjoyment. There are three additional pairs of silicon gel eartips included for your selection.
* We will send you an email survey for your selection.

The shipping fee will be added when you select your country at the perk contribution checkout. We will ship Aero using your country's postal service. Tax and duties are not included. We will email you a shipment notification and your tracking number when we initiate the delivery.
We strongly suggest you to add support@zorloo.com to your contact list (especially for gmail) so that this notification email won't be mistakenly pushed into your SPAM inbox.
* ROW means Rest of the World

Get 20% off your perk if you refer 4 contributors
Get a free Aero if you refer 10 contributors

Be our team and let more people know about the Aero campaign, share it on Faceback, Twitter, Instagram, blogs, newsgroup, forums and other sites!

For years, we have been lighting up homes, bars, cars, clothes, plants, pets, toilets, and art. From the beginning, we saw a need for ruggedized, weather-proof (and semi-waterproof!) addressable LEDs in a workable form-factor that were portable and easy to add anywhere -- flexible enough for a fur coat, yet rigid enough not to break at the joints. Since then, our lights have lit our campsites at Burning Man, projects at dozens of festivals, DJ lighting in bars and nightclubs around San Diego, and vehicles from skateboards to yachts. They've survived hot tub parties in Mexico, the staircase of the ""Charlie the Unicorn"" art-car, they accent shelves and desks in our homes and offices, and we even have them under my truck*!
(*Often not street legal, consult local laws.)

column2: >Photos by Jessica Bernstein, Video by Ken Kondo, Music by MikeyLion

column1: We've developed an easy-to-use phone app (Android+iOS, requires BlueTooth 4.0) for changing patterns, adjusting speed and brightness, and even syncing up multiple brains (via realtime clock) together.
But for all the problems our ruggedized 3-segment LEDs have solved, some limitations still exist in our current product:
<li>The lights are professionally manufactured, but the ""brain"" unit is not
column2: we have to hand-solder, heat-shrink and hot-glue each unit. The result is, frankly, that our controllers are the least-resilient link in our chain.

column1: • Doing bluetooth-enabled or sound-responsive projects requires adding in extra (relatively expensive) daughterboards, again with more soldering, trial-and-error, and often more than a few mistakes and re-attempts at each unit we produce.

<li>Upgrading our supply chain is limited by our low margins, high manufacturing costs (because of small batch sizes) and the significant amount of time we have to spend on every sale as we solder, assemble and personally install each project. Every time we order another batch, it takes 4-6 weeks of waiting and telling our customers ""Sorry, out of stock right now""
column2: this year, we ran out right before Burning Man, and everybody panicked!

column1: We need all-in-one Brains in hard plastic enclosures, and by partnering with a new US manufacturer, we're able to further increase the quality of our already market-changing LED segments. We need our packages pre-assembled out of the factory without hours of manual work for every kit. We need boxes -- REAL BOXES! -- so that each kit looks like something you'd buy in stores -- REAL STORES! Here at JuiceJuice, we are committed to delivering the brightest smiles possible, but right now we just can't deliver them fast enough. You can help us light up the world
column2: get us the funding we need to ramp up production!
>At the completion of our campaign, we guarantee that (parts of) your life will be no less than 1,000 times brighter-and-more-colorful than ever before*.

column1: (* based on assumption that you had no rainbow lights ever before)

We keep saying ""rainbows"" because, let's be honest, rainbow is the best color. Everything defaults to rainbows, and you will be happy and prosperous if you just leave them like that forever, a fortune cookie told us so.
But our lights will do any patterns, color combinations and fade effects you can possibly dream up. We're even building a way for you to design your own and put them on an SD card.

We're going to include a base set of at least 30 novel patterns - Possibly even some more kinds of rainbows! Most of the patterns will be optionally sound responsive, and many of them will support setting the hues of the pattern from a color wheel in the phone app. If you just love maroon, you can make everything maroon -- shooting stars, dancing flames, chasing waves, blah, blah, blah. Paint a wall Red, White and Blue for the Olympics. Scare away cats and unwanted guests with sound-activated strobe lights.

Want green explosions in your bookshelf, purple waves down your staircase and red lava around the tub? No problem. Switch your bed frame to red heartbeats, put on some Barry White, BOOM! Date night. And on a Saturday night, sound-activated rainbows turn absolutely any occasion into a dance party.

The Sparks are WS2812b modules running at 5 volts. The clear IP67 (that means ""almost completely water-and-dust-proof"") epoxy coat and novel 3-LED hard PCB format are of our own design, though we've seen them imitated (ahem, poorly) from several suppliers. We've gone through tons of iterations to perfect our construction of what we believe to be one of the most convenient, flexible and long-lasting addressable LED products on the market.
They come in 3-inch segments of 3 LEDs, spaced 1.5"" apart. Each 5-foot strand is 12 segments, for a total of 36 LEDs, and terminated with 3-pin IP67 screw-on caps.

The sparks are weather-proof, and great for outdoor applications as well. We use them in the snow, in the mud, in the garden and by the pool. We must legally insist you do not try submerging them, in swimming pools, fish tanks or otherwise. Do not take JuiceJuice Sparks into your hot tub. You may observe that they do light up underwater, but it is. not. safe. Keep Brain and Power Supply in a dry location. DO NOT PLAY WITH ELECTRICITY AND WATER.

Our control units are Arduino-based boards upgraded with Bluetooth, a realtime clock, an SD slot for custom patterns and a microphone. We include a high-wattage 12v barrel plug for wall-socket applications, but you can also run up to 100 lights off USB, such as portable battery packs, car adapters or *shudder* even technically your laptop.  Use the 12v adapter for more than 100 lights, always.

We'll distribute the sketches for all the patterns we design so you can modify your own designs and make anything you like. It's also in our aspirations to create a GUI-based pattern designer in the phone app, but this is not within the immediate scope of our project, so we've made it a Stretch Goal.
We think the minimum amount we can reasonably accept for meeting these goals is $75,000 green American monies (but IndieGoGo will take AUR and EUR as well!)

One Basic Kit is $200 and includes 2x Spark Strips, each a 5-foot string of 36 LEDs in 12 segments of 3, which you can chain together end-to-end for a 10-foot strip. You get 1 Brain, which can drive up to 500 LEDs (70 feet!), and the necessary power supply. For our first 100 backers, to show our utmost appreciation, we'll forego any margin and deliver them to you at-cost, $160 flat (plus shipping).

We also offer a Mega Kit for $350, which has twice as many LEDs, in case your addiction to visual stimulation is both impulsive and insatiable like ours. With 1 Brain and 4x 5-foot Spark Strips, you can wrap a VW bus in colors and patterns faster and easier than a team of hippies with paintbrushes (plus our lights can take a shower).

We offer price breaks as you buy more kits all the way up to $2,500. For larger orders, just contact us, because we're used to working on big projects. Beyond 10+ Mega Kits, there are lots more things to keep in mind about placement, power and synchronization. Let's just have a quick phone call before we accept so much cash from you.

One more thing -- We believe businesses are people, too, and that implies a moral obligation for them to do good. Just as we feel an individual should donate 10% of their earnings to charity, we are budgeting 10% of our profits from IndieGoGo to spread light around the world. There are dark villages in Africa, literally unlit, and we cannot with clean conscious sell you amazing beautiful luxury lights for your first-world-lifestyle without also allocating some money to mail boxes of solar lights to every dark corner of the earth. The price of doing business with our company is your complete agreement to these ideals.
We really hope you like our lights. We hope we meet our goals.
But we're builders and we won't be satisfied at that --
Our plans to grow our capabilities are ambitious and exciting.
Here's some things we plan to do in the future, and if we hit higher funding goals, we'll stop ""planning"" and start on them right away.

• $150,000 - Code Tutorial: Right after we deliver our initial offering, we plan on making a ""How To Code Light Patterns"" tutorial. It will cover the basics of Arduino programming, the Processing language, and doing some simple-to-moderately-complex effects. Not only will these tutorials be available free for everyone, we'll mail 10 kits to local San Diego schools to help teach kids to code through a charity we are starting called Bright Young Minds.

• $250,00 - Point-and-Click Pattern Designer: Use your phone app to design any pattern you want, save it for later, sync it to other Brains and make it yours. If you can dream it, you can make it, no coding skills required.
<li>$400,000 - Pattern Sharing Social Site - An online library for sharing and trading patterns
column2: a secure and fun way to download new effects from other users around the world.

column1: Whenever bringing a product to market, many challenges can arise and many expensive road blocks can arise.
On the one hand, there's the immediate risk that we won't make our funding goal. We'll do our best to still make as many improvements to the brains as we can and ship the lights.

On the other hand, the risk does exist that we collect the full $75,000 and either under-budgeted or mis-calculated the costs of the project. Look, we feel good about this plan. We think we can make it work. And we are honest dudes who will do the right thing at every step of the way, no matter what comes up. Your investment in our project entitles you to the very best product our efforts can muster, but you must agree to usual the risks of a crowd-funding campaign.
Also, our timeline right now is all based on VERY ROUGH estimates
column2: before donating, please know that we hope to achieve all our dreams and deliver by the end of January, but it could be 2 months late, a week early, or whatever.

column1: Leeward - Founder, inventor, developer, pretty face and business model
Audrey - Marketing, customer service and getting people to like us better
Robert - Chief Executive of Social Good, charities liaison, outreach program
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
• Share our campaign on social media to help us get the word out!
• Know of a bar, club or internet cafe that is under-lit or dimly decorated? Recommend they check us out!

For years, we have been lighting up homes, bars, cars, clothes, plants, pets, toilets, and art. From the beginning, we saw a need for ruggedized, weather-proof (and semi-waterproof!) addressable LEDs in a workable form-factor that were portable and easy to add anywhere -- flexible enough for a fur coat, yet rigid enough not to break at the joints. Since then, our lights have lit our campsites at Burning Man, projects at dozens of festivals, DJ lighting in bars and nightclubs around San Diego, and vehicles from skateboards to yachts. They've survived hot tub parties in Mexico, the staircase of the ""Charlie the Unicorn"" art-car, they accent shelves and desks in our homes and offices, and we even have them under my truck*!
(*Often not street legal, consult local laws.)
Photos by Jessica Bernstein, Video by Ken Kondo, Music by MikeyLion

We've developed an easy-to-use phone app (Android+iOS, requires BlueTooth 4.0) for changing patterns, adjusting speed and brightness, and even syncing up multiple brains (via realtime clock) together.
But for all the problems our ruggedized 3-segment LEDs have solved, some limitations still exist in our current product:
The lights are professionally manufactured, but the ""brain"" unit is not
column2: we have to hand-solder, heat-shrink and hot-glue each unit. The result is, frankly, that our controllers are the least-resilient link in our chain.

column1: Doing bluetooth-enabled or sound-responsive projects requires adding in extra (relatively expensive) daughterboards, again with more soldering, trial-and-error, and often more than a few mistakes and re-attempts at each unit we produce.

Upgrading our supply chain is limited by our low margins, high manufacturing costs (because of small batch sizes) and the significant amount of time we have to spend on every sale as we solder, assemble and personally install each project. Every time we order another batch, it takes 4-6 weeks of waiting and telling our customers ""Sorry, out of stock right now""
column2: this year, we ran out right before Burning Man, and everybody panicked!

column1: We need all-in-one Brains in hard plastic enclosures, and by partnering with a new US manufacturer, we're able to further increase the quality of our already market-changing LED segments. We need our packages pre-assembled out of the factory without hours of manual work for every kit. We need boxes -- REAL BOXES! -- so that each kit looks like something you'd buy in stores -- REAL STORES! Here at JuiceJuice, we are committed to delivering the brightest smiles possible, but right now we just can't deliver them fast enough. You can help us light up the world
column2: get us the funding we need to ramp up production!

column1: At the completion of our campaign, we guarantee that (parts of) your life will be no less than 1,000 times brighter-and-more-colorful than ever before*.
(* based on assumption that you had no rainbow lights ever before)

We keep saying ""rainbows"" because, let's be honest, rainbow is the best color. Everything defaults to rainbows, and you will be happy and prosperous if you just leave them like that forever, a fortune cookie told us so.
But our lights will do any patterns, color combinations and fade effects you can possibly dream up. We're even building a way for you to design your own and put them on an SD card.

We're going to include a base set of at least 30 novel patterns - Possibly even some more kinds of rainbows! Most of the patterns will be optionally sound responsive, and many of them will support setting the hues of the pattern from a color wheel in the phone app. If you just love maroon, you can make everything maroon -- shooting stars, dancing flames, chasing waves, blah, blah, blah. Paint a wall Red, White and Blue for the Olympics. Scare away cats and unwanted guests with sound-activated strobe lights.

Want green explosions in your bookshelf, purple waves down your staircase and red lava around the tub? No problem. Switch your bed frame to red heartbeats, put on some Barry White, BOOM! Date night. And on a Saturday night, sound-activated rainbows turn absolutely any occasion into a dance party.

The Sparks are WS2812b modules running at 5 volts. The clear IP67 (that means ""almost completely water-and-dust-proof"") epoxy coat and novel 3-LED hard PCB format are of our own design, though we've seen them imitated (ahem, poorly) from several suppliers. We've gone through tons of iterations to perfect our construction of what we believe to be one of the most convenient, flexible and long-lasting addressable LED products on the market.
They come in 3-inch segments of 3 LEDs, spaced 1.5"" apart. Each 5-foot strand is 12 segments, for a total of 36 LEDs, and terminated with 3-pin IP67 screw-on caps.

The sparks are weather-proof, and great for outdoor applications as well. We use them in the snow, in the mud, in the garden and by the pool. We must legally insist you do not try submerging them, in swimming pools, fish tanks or otherwise. Do not take JuiceJuice Sparks into your hot tub. You may observe that they do light up underwater, but it is. not. safe. Keep Brain and Power Supply in a dry location. DO NOT PLAY WITH ELECTRICITY AND WATER.

It's also in our aspirations to create a GUI-based pattern designer in the phone app, but this is not within the immediate scope of our project, so we've made it a Stretch Goal.

We think the minimum amount we can reasonably accept for meeting these goals is $75,000 green American monies (but IndieGoGo will take AUR and EUR as well!)

One Basic Kit is $200 and includes 2x Spark Strips, each a 5-foot string of 36 LEDs in 12 segments of 3, which you can chain together end-to-end for a 10-foot strip. You get 1 Brain, which can drive up to 500 LEDs (70 feet!), and the necessary power supply. For our first 100 backers, to show our utmost appreciation, we'll forego any margin and deliver them to you at-cost, $160 flat (plus shipping).

We also offer a Mega Kit for $350, which has twice as many LEDs, in case your addiction to visual stimulation is both impulsive and insatiable like ours. With 1 Brain and 4x 5-foot Spark Strips, you can wrap a VW bus in colors and patterns faster and easier than a team of hippies with paintbrushes (plus our lights can take a shower).

We offer price breaks as you buy more kits all the way up to $2,500. For larger orders, just contact us, because we're used to working on big projects. Beyond 10+ Mega Kits, there are lots more things to keep in mind about placement, power and synchronization. Let's just have a quick phone call before we accept so much cash from you.

We got tired of our earbuds breaking all the time too ...

Yep, we got tired of constantly buying earbuds too so we decided to crowdsource a company to make better ones.  The company is called Acoustic Forge.  Our first product is IRONbuds, a rugged, modular, repairable earphone system designed for high-end sound by audio engineering veterans.

Last year, a wonderful group of 1078 crowdfund-backers pledged funds to launch Acoustic Forge operations.  For over 6 months we worked closely with them and we have just finished the design of the first 2 IRONbuds models. Full production is just about to start!
We want you to join the team!
This is a collaborative venture and we invite you to participate. If you pledge for IRONbuds now, you will get great audio gear and you provide the financial fuel to build this organization.
If we can get Acoustic Forge capitalized quickly, you are going to see some great things happen ... and you will be part of it.

There are five pledge levels for IRONbuds.  Photos of these products are shown in the Gallery (tab at the top).  Each type of IRONbud model has several options (earphone type, cable colors, etc.) that you can choose from.  We will send out a form when the campaign ends where you can choose which options you would like, provide your shipping information and other details.
This may be the most important part of all: let everyone know about Acoustic Forge.

Tell them there is a new, collectively-driven company that is rejecting the premise of disposable electronic products and believes modularity and repairability is the future of responsible product design.
Oh, and they will save a ton of money and get great-sounding earbuds that they will own a very long time.
PS  A few other things On The Drawing Board.

at ColorRight, we've been making awesome white balance tools and flash
diffusers for over 5 years. We've even won awards for our ColorRight PRO

line of color balance tools. 

Now, we want to introduce you to the LuxBox.

So
far, we have made 4 working prototypes of this
revolutionary type of LED panel light that works for both photo and
Video. The LuxBox and My Light Pro light are ultra thin LED panels (3/4"") that
have pro grade light and quality. LuxBox and My Lite use our LEDNatural technology for ultra soft light
softbox. At just 6.8 ounces and 8 ounces (with the battery) these panels are your Uber Go Anywhere, Do
Anything lighting solution.

We can't get

family and friends and through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc. This

Thank you so much for supporting the future of photo and video lighting with your contribution!

column9: > is a small USB device with a single purpose:
column13:
>Making it easy to create Bitcoin paper wallets in a secure controlled environment.

Paper wallets are created in 3 simple steps:

column3: >Insert Mycelium Entropy into a printer that allows you to print pictures from a USB flash drive.
>Select the print option on the printer.

column1:
This way the paper wallet has never touched a computer or a network, and as soon as you eject the device the private key is wiped from memory.

Mycelium Entropy is the easiest and most secure way of creating a paper wallet for offline cold storage.


How does it work?

When Mycelium Entropy is inserted into a USB socket, it powers up and generates a large random number based on hardware entropy. That number is turned into a Bitcoin private key and a Bitcoin address. The private key and the address are turned into QR codes and and stored in a JPG file, and the USB device presents itself as a USB flash drive. This allows a printer that can print photos off a USB flash drive to print the paper wallet directly off the device.

Here is a paper wallet sample: http://i.imgur.com/L36LZgY.jpg

The hardware based entropy is collected by using a chip with static RAM as the source of entropy, as described in the scientific paper: Power-up SRAM State as an Identifying Fingerprint and Source of True Random Numbers (Holcomb, D.E.
column3:
Fu, K.).

Quote from the article: ""We demonstrate that a 512-bite SRAM fingerprint contains sufficient entropy to generate 128-bit true random numbers, and that the generated numbers pass the NIST tests for runs, approximate entropy, and block-frequency.""

Because Mycelium Entropy collects entropy from tens of thousands of SRAM cells, the result is impossible to guess. Every time you plug the device into a USB port, the power-up process makes the SRAM cells contain a completely random state, allowing the chip to create a different high entropy random number. This allows you to make as many safe and secure paper wallets as you wish.

When paired with the Mycelium Bitcoin Wallet, with its ability to spend directly from cold storage paper wallets, storing and using Bitcoin securely becomes very easy for anyone.

Here is a video showing Jan, one of our lead developers, demonstrating the prototype:
column8:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Mycelium Entropy will be 100% open source, and uses off-the-shelf components. It is fully programmable and more features can be added over time. We will make it trivially easy to flash the device using either firmware you download from us, signed with our key, or with your own custom changes to our source code. This is your guarantee that the device does not contain any malware or back doors. Flashing is as easy as plugging it in, turning on flash mode, and copying files over to the drive. You will be able to download the sources, make any changes, build your own and flash the device.

From the very start Mycelium Entropy will, in addition to supporting classic paper wallets, also support 2-of-3 split private keys using a technique called Shamir's Secret Sharing. This allows you to split a private key into 3 paper shares, where any two of the three shares are needed to get access to your bitcoins. That way, if one of your shares gets lost or stolen, you can still combine the remaining two shares to get access to your funds. This is far superior to any password encrypted private key scheme.

Here is a sample: http://i.imgur.com/CGHWIcS.jpg

Going forward we plan to add the option of generating master seeds for BIP32 HD wallets as a downloadable upgrade.

Mycelium Entropy will be made in Europe and assembled in Austria (known for its strict privacy laws), and will be shipped in a hologram sealed box to prevent tampering while en-route.


Reason for Raising Money

Although the device hardware is open source, we need to raise money to be able to order them in sufficient enough quantities to make them cheaper for everyone. Mass production is much cheaper than ordering them one at a time. Also, about $1,500 of the money raised will go towards testing and compliance for these types of devices, like CE marks, FCC part 15 approvals, etc. While the devices are being developed, we will spend time testing printers and putting together a list of recommended printers to use with these, just to make sure that yours can handle this, or if it can't, to help you find the cheapest (and most secure) option you can get.


Stretch goals

If we raise $30,000, we will add Litecoin support as a downloadable feature.

If we raise $40,000, we will add the second more popular blockchain-based cryptocurrency by market cap, which at present is PeerCoin

If we raise$60,000, wow. such money. very rich. have dogecoin.

If we somehow miraculously manage to raise $120,000, we will forgo all sleep for the next two month, and get HD out by the time we ship these.


Risks and challenges

The device designs are finished, and the prototypes are fully functional. We also have manufacturers lined up, ready to assemble the units for us. We just need the funding to start the initial run of production. The only problems we may run into are related to the manufacturers, such as unforeseen production delays, though we believe they will be unlikely.


List of Printers Tested So Far

Brother HL-4150CDN Color Laser - OK
Brother MFC-J875DW Wireless All-In-One - resets printer when trying to print
Brother MFC-8710DW All-in-One Laser - OK
Brother MFC-9970CDW Color All-in-One Laser - OK

Most Canon printers do not have USB ports.
Canon i560 - does not work
Canon imageCLASS MF8280CW Color Laser - OK
Canon Selphy CP910 - comes out plain white on multiple sheets
Canon PIXMA-MG6250 - OK

Epson XP-610 - OK
Epson XP-810 - OK
Epson XP-850 - OK
Epson WF-2540 - No way to print photos from USB
Epson WF-3520 All-in-One - OK
Epson WF-3540 All-in-One - OK
Epson WP-4540 - No way to print photos from USB
Epson WF-7510 Wide-format All-in-One - OK

HP Envy 120 Wireless - OK
HP LaserJet Pro 200 Color - OK
HP LaserJet Pro MFP M476dw - OK
HP Officejet 6700 Premium - OK
HP Officejet Pro 8600 Plus - OK
HP Officejet Pro 8610 - OK
HP Officejet Pro 8630 - OK
HP Photosmart 7520 - OK

<div>See the dedicated site at <a href=""http://buddhify.com/"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" style=""color: rgb(255, 0, 87)
Be part of the future of modern meditation

buddhify needs to raise $4500 to cover the cost of marketing and promotion in the critical first few months of its launch so that it can make the impact that we know it can.  So we're turning to our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering some killer perks including personalised meditations, limited run t-shirts and of course free versions of what will be a paid app.  Your contribution will help us realise the potential of buddhify by raising awareness of it to so many more people than we could otherwise do.

column3: >I am incredibly passionate about relevant 21st century meditation and have written about the subject for many years at my award-winning blog 21awake.com.  And all the while for my day job I work with organisations who are looking to become more innovative and do amazing things with new technology.  buddhify represents the coming together of these two parts of my life - the innovation work and my deep interest in and experience of meditation.

","From its striking visuals to its highly customised meditation tracks and totally unique bonus features such as Two Player Meditation, buddhify is a wonderfully creative & innovative app.  It takes meditation to a completely new place and solves the problem that so many people in the world are interested in meditation as a way to improve their wellbeing but are unable to find an accessible route in.  Until now.

Hello, I'm Rohan and I'm the chap behind buddhify - the world's first mass market modern meditation mobile app.  The app itself will be ready later this Autumn and be available for iPhones and Android phones and together with an amazing project team, progress towards the launch is going really well.

buddhify is a project which I have completely self-funded and while I can just about afford to do that to the point where the apps are actually built and available for use, it's at that point that I need support to get the word out about it. That's where you come in.
See the dedicated site at www.buddhify.com
Be part of the future of modern meditation

buddhify needs to raise $4500 to cover the cost of marketing and promotion in the critical first few months of its launch so that it can make the impact that we know it can.  So we're turning to our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering some killer perks including personalised meditations, limited run t-shirts and of course free versions of what will be a paid app.  Your contribution will help us realise the potential of buddhify by raising awareness of it to so many more people than we could otherwise do.

I am incredibly passionate about relevant 21st century meditation and have written about the subject for many years at my award-winning blog 21awake.com.  And all the while for my day job I work with organisations who are looking to become more innovative and do amazing things with new technology.  buddhify represents the coming together of these two parts of my life - the innovation work and my deep interest in and experience of meditation.
How the money will be spent

As I said, I've spent a bunch of my own money on this project - $9000 of cash and at least that again of my freelance time which I could have been charging out to clients - and it's been a pleasure to do so.  The $4500 raised here will be used to fund a marketing & PR specialist and any associated campaign costs.  Given how ""sticky"" the idea of learning to meditate out&about in the city is, the marketing and promotional work will focus 80% on social media and 20% on traditional media channels.  We will provide a detailed breakdown of how the money is spent as the project continues.
Even if you feel you're not able to support the campaign financially, there are some things you can do to support this campaign:
Share the link of this page with your friends and followers on Facebook and Twitter
Join the buddhify mailing list to hear the latest news

column2: > 1.5 Billion people around the world live without a reliable source of electricity and are forced to turn to unsafe, unhealthy, expensive, environmentally unfriendly kerosene lamps among other forms of unhealthy lighting.

column1: Unite to Light is a non-profit based in Santa Barbara, California created to address this problem. Our lights are designed and developed at the Institute for Energy Efficiency at UC Santa Barbara. We are a growing community of people working to send solar powered products around the world as an alternative to kerosene lamps. Our first product, an all-purpose solar powered LED (UTL-1), addresses our goal of greatly reducing, even eliminating, kerosene use in developing countries.

column2: >But we can't stop there! There are currently more cell phones than people in the world, and every year a new small electronic device offers opportunities for individuals to learn and connect. We need your help producing our next product, the UTL-C, a cellphone and e-reader charging light!

>Imagine the possibilities of the UTL-C in the developing world! With your help we will be able to continue to provide an alternative to kerosene, and in addition, we give someone the possibility of charging their cellphone and e-reader sustainably. In developing countries a cell phone is someone's lifeline. Cell phones improve profits for small business owners and farmers, are a cheaper and faster way of communication, increase productivity, and provide many other benefits we take for granted. Since many individuals in developing countries often do not have electricity, they often travel for miles and pay a lot to charge their cell phones. Having their own solar charger and light will save them time and money.

column1: With 1.5 billion people living without reliable electricity and relying on their cellphones for work and study, a personal
column2: >USB charging capability solves a problem and offers an environmentally friendly alternative. For those who live, work, study or play off the grid, the concept of solar energy for simple functions such as lighting and USB charging makes sense. The sun provides 1kW of power per square meter, why waste it?

/>Unite to Light is a non-profit located in Santa Barbara, California. When a professor and pastor from Ghana visited the Institute for Energy Efficiency at UC Santa Barbara they explained the problem of children not having a <span style=""color: #ff6600
column3: > healthy and safe form of light at night for their studies. With their visit as the driving force, Unite to Light was created in 2010 to address the concerns of kerosene use. We are dedicated to providing
column4: > low cost lighting to those without electricity, and eliminating the health and environmental issues associated with existing light sources used by this population. In doing so, we will allow families the opportunity to work, study, and play in the evening while

column1: We have designed lights for this purpose, and are partnering with organizations on the ground in communities around the world to distribute lights for purchase. Parents are able to better feed their families and send children to school with the money they save by not buying kerosene, candles, and orther short term lighting sources. In turn, Unite to Light is able to produce and distribute more lights on an ongoing basis.
For more information please visit www.unite-to-light.org.
Right now the cost of manufacturing the UTL-C is
column2: > too expensive for the developing world. We need
column3: > your help to subsidize the initial costs of the UTL-C and help pay for the mold and prototypes. With your help we can remove the burden (cost) of the mold and protoypes from our end users, and provide the
column4: > cheapest UTL-C possible. With lower prices, we can reach a wider range of individuals and families that can benefit from the UTL-C.

column1: Your contribution will give individuals and families the
column2: > gift of light and the possibility of increasing their
column3: > quality of life. The map below shows the countries where we are making a difference. Together we can light up the world country by country.

column1: “My name is Lewis Ayenza. I am in class eight, Mr. Kimathi gave me a solar lamp. Now I can read about 2 hours when I go home at night. I can work hard because my mother can take the solar lamp and keep it under the sun to charge. We do not have electricity and sometimes we were not having money for buying paraffin. But now as I have that solar lamp it helps me and I read and do my studies well. Am so happy about it.” -- Lewis A.

column2: />""We were able to bring to village these really cool solar powered reading lights. The villagers loved them, and everyone wanted to take one home. They have no electricity in the village and fires in their homes (most have thatched straw roofs, the richer people have tin), lung disease from breathing smoke (they use wood and dung to cook with) and burns from injuries while working and using fire are common. I made it clear the lights were to stay in their new library, and that I would return to America to try to raise money for more for village homes."" -
column3: > HANDS in NEPAL , one of our partners.

column1: ""As a [Peace Corps] teacher in Ghana, I’ve never heard the ‘My dog ate my homework’ excuse but I have heard ‘Madam, I couldn’t do my homework because we don’t have lights.’"" - Stephanie, a Peace Corps volunteer in

""One of the couples on the trip brought lights from Unite to Light to give to the native Tarahumara people (they call themselves the Rarámuri) who live in cliff side dwellings and use kerosene lamps for light. I got to see first hand the impact of the blackened walls and can only imagine the damage being
column2: />done to the lungs of the children and the people. It is truly a wonderful thing that you are doing. Thank you for your global concern and generosity."" by Fritz<span style=""color: #ff6600

column1: ""The Unite to Light solar lights were a BIG hit with the teachers! Uganda is a land where the power is constantly going out in the evening, and the acrid small of burning trash with kerosene and diesel cars makes for a very toxic environment. There were most days when I never saw a blue sky. These lights will really help the teachers, especially those who live in the areas we are working in, to be able to lesson plan and read student work at night. They were actually hugging me when I gave them the lights!"" - Vicky, one of our partners at Turn the Page

""I’ve noticed that their academic performances are improving, their punctuality to school in the morning has also improved... We would be very grateful if we get more lamps for those who didn’t get one."" -- Headmaster Kingston K
column2: > (Kenya), commenting on the performance of his students who received a light.

column1: Read more stories on our Facebook page.

Our exciting gifts to you for your contributions are our first product, UTL-1, and our new product, UTL-C. Please note that the final version of the UTL-C may vary slightly than the one in the video based on product improvements.

Unite to Light USB Charger / LED Light (UTL-C)
(1) 1.2W Silicon Solar Panel
(1) >
column2:
10Wh non-removable Lithium battery (upgrade from prototype)
(1) 45 Lumen White LED
(1) USB Charging Port (works on cell phones, kindles, and small USB charged electronics)

column1: Please visit http://www.unite-to-light.org/specifications.html for the specification of our UTL-1.

1.5 Billion people around the world live without a reliable source of electricity and are forced to turn to unsafe, unhealthy, expensive, environmentally unfriendly kerosene lamps among other forms of unhealthy lighting.

Unite to Light is a non-profit based in Santa Barbara, California created to address this problem. Our lights are designed and developed at the Institute for Energy Efficiency at UC Santa Barbara. We are a growing community of people working to send solar powered products around the world as an alternative to kerosene lamps. Our first product, an all-purpose solar powered LED (UTL-1), addresses our goal of greatly reducing, even eliminating, kerosene use in developing countries.

But we can't stop there! There are currently more cell phones than people in the world, and every year a new small electronic device offers opportunities for individuals to learn and connect. We need your help producing our next product, the UTL-C, a cellphone and e-reader charging light!

Imagine the possibilities of the UTL-C in the developing world! With your help we will be able to continue to provide an alternative to kerosene, and in addition, we give someone the possibility of charging their cellphone and e-reader sustainably. In developing countries a cell phone is someone's lifeline. Cell phones improve profits for small business owners and farmers, are a cheaper and faster way of communication, increase productivity, and provide many other benefits we take for granted. Since many individuals in developing countries often do not have electricity, they often travel for miles and pay a lot to charge their cell phones. Having their own solar charger and light will save them time and money.

With 1.5 billion people living without reliable electricity and relying on their cellphones for work and study, a personal USB charging capability  solves a problem and offers an environmentally friendly alternative. For those who live, work, study or play off the grid, the concept of solar energy for simple functions such as lighting and USB charging makes sense. The sun provides 1kW of power per square meter, why waste it?

Unite to Light is a non-profit located in Santa Barbara, California. When a professor and pastor from Ghana visited the Institute for Energy Efficiency at UC Santa Barbara they explained the problem of children not having a  healthy and safe form of light at night for their studies. With their visit as the driving force, Unite to Light was created in 2010 to address the concerns of kerosene use. We are dedicated to providing  low cost lighting to those without electricity, and eliminating the health and environmental issues associated with existing light sources used by this population. In doing so, we will allow families the opportunity to work, study, and play in the evening while  breathing clean (healthy) air.

We have designed lights for this purpose, and are partnering with organizations on the ground in communities around the world to distribute lights for purchase. Parents are able to better feed their families and send children to school with the money they save by not buying kerosene, candles, and orther short term lighting sources. In turn, Unite to Light is able to produce and distribute more lights on an ongoing basis.
For more information please visit www.unite-to-light.org.

Right now the cost of manufacturing the UTL-C is  too expensive  for the developing world. We need  your help  to subsidize the initial costs of the UTL-C and help pay for the mold and prototypes. With your help we can remove the burden (cost) of the mold and protoypes from our end users, and provide the  cheapest UTL-C possible. With lower prices, we can reach a wider range of individuals and families that can benefit from the UTL-C.

Your contribution will give individuals and families the  gift of light and the possibility of increasing their  quality of life. The map below shows the countries where we are making a difference. Together we can light up the world country by country.

“My name is Lewis Ayenza. I am in class eight, Mr. Kimathi gave me a solar lamp. Now I can read about 2 hours when I go home at night. I can work hard because my mother can take the solar lamp and keep it under the sun to charge. We do not have electricity and sometimes we were not having money for buying paraffin. But now as I have that solar lamp it helps me and I read and do my studies well. Am so happy about it.” -- Lewis A.  (Kenya)

We were able to bring to village these really cool solar powered reading lights. The villagers loved them, and everyone wanted to take one home. They have no electricity in the village and fires in their homes (most have thatched straw roofs, the richer people have tin), lung disease from breathing smoke (they use wood and dung to cook with) and burns from injuries while working and using fire are common. I made it clear the lights were to stay in their new library, and that I would return to America to try to raise money for more for village homes."" -  HANDS in NEPAL , one of our partners.

As a [Peace Corps] teacher in Ghana, I’ve never heard the ‘My dog ate my homework’ excuse but I have heard ‘Madam, I couldn’t do my homework because we don’t have lights.’"" - Stephanie, a Peace Corps volunteer in  Ghana.

One of the couples on the trip brought lights from Unite to Light to give to the native Tarahumara people (they call themselves the Rarámuri) who live in cliff side dwellings and use kerosene lamps for light. I got to see first hand the impact of the blackened walls and can only imagine the damage being done to the lungs of the children and the people. It is truly a wonderful thing that you are doing. Thank you for your global concern and generosity."" by Fritz (Mexico)

The Unite to Light solar lights were a BIG hit with the teachers! Uganda is a land where the power is constantly going out in the evening, and the acrid small of burning trash with kerosene and diesel cars makes for a very toxic environment. There were most days when I never saw a blue sky. These lights will really help the teachers, especially those who live in the areas we are working in, to be able to lesson plan and read student work at night. They were actually hugging me when I gave them the lights!"" - Vicky, one of our partners at Turn the Page  Uganda.

I’ve noticed that their academic performances are improving, their punctuality to school in the morning has also improved... We would be very grateful if we get more lamps for those who didn’t get one."" -- Headmaster Kingston K  (Kenya), commenting on the performance of his students who received a light.
Read more stories on our Facebook page.

Our exciting gifts to you for your contributions are our first product, UTL-1, and our new product, UTL-C. Please note that the final version of the UTL-C may vary slightly than the one in the video based on product improvements.

Please visit http://www.unite-to-light.org/specifications.html for the specification of our UTL-1.",12.0,0,"1 Campaign

column6:
>We've all felt it. The sinking feeling of watching your phone die before your very eyes, all because you didn't charge it enough.

You could scramble to find someone with a charger, but what if there isn't one around? 

There are many portable phone chargers available, but most are either made of plastic, don't hold enough charge, are heavy, or are unattractive. 

Why can't there be a portable phone charger that is strong yet lightweight, convenient, unique, AND stylish?

Well, now there is. 

Meet the T-Bolt, the first portable cell phone charger made from...Titanium.
column8:
>scroll down for more color options (pink, blue, gold, etc.)

Titanium is the ideal building material. It's what makes the T-Bolt incredibly strong and durable, yet lightweight. It's also the perfect material to protect lithium-ion batteries from getting punctured or crushed. 

Virtually all other portable phone chargers are worthless once the battery loses capacity. That's not the case with the T-Bolt! It features a screw-on top that allows you to change the battery in seconds! 

This high-quality charger is made to last
column9: since the battery inside is replaceable, it may just be the last portable cell phone charger you'll ever need to purchase!
column11:
>

You can use the T-Bolt to charge cell phones, tablets, or anything that charges with a USB. Clip it on/in your backpack for a battery boost mid-day. Store one in your purse, bag, or car in case of an emergency. Bring it on your camping or hiking trip––it's corrosion resistant (nearly impossible to rust) and can handle the occasional drop or two. 

The T-Bolt also makes a great gift for birthdays, graduation presents, Mother's Day, Father's Day, road trips, camping trips, music festivals, conventions, meetings and business trips, and so much more!

column1: • You're tired of wasting money on cheap plastic cell phone chargers that break.
• You love to go hiking or camping and need a phone charger that can withstand the elements.
• You want to have a charger that is different than any other on the market.
• You need an awesome gift for Mother's Day, Father's Day, birthdays, or graduations.
• You want a phone charger that is sophisticated and classy.
• You need to charge your phone while you're skydiving out of a helicopter on a secret mission.

Or, 

  • If you love titanium products!
column2:
>carabiner and keyring not included

T-Bolt Warranty

100% of T-Bolt manufacturing will be completed in-house at our CNC machine shop, New-Tech Tooling. 

We are offering a full, lifetime warranty for the T-Bolt! We're very confident in the quality of the T-Bolt and proudly stand behind it.

If you are dissatisfied or have a problem with your T-Bolt for any reason, return it to us and we'll repair or replace it free of charge. This warranty only applies to the titanium casing and the charging electronics. The battery is an expendable part of the T-Bolt that can wear out from normal use, and therefore, is not covered by this warranty.

*We will finalize details of the warranty at a later date, but the information shared above will remain the same.
column3:
>works with iPhone and Android

Product Specifications

HIGH CAPACITY T-BOLT

We're also offering a high capacity T-Bolt retains the modular design of the standard T-Bolt, yet doubles its capacity. The standard T-Bolt comes with a 2600mAh 18650 style lithium-ion battery. The high capacity T-Bolt comes with two 2600mAh batteries, allowing you to effectively charge larger devices.

When you order a T-Bolt, you get to choose the color you'd like yours to be. Nine anodized color options are already set: Silver, Gold, Bronze, Copper, Dark Blue, Light Blue, Indigo, Violet, and Pink.
column4:
/>

We are a boyfriend/girlfriend team running a small CNC machine shop based in St. Cloud, Minnesota. Caleb is a machinist and entrepreneur. Brittany currently goes to Union College in Lincoln, NE and is pursuing a double major in Marketing and Emerging Media. 

If you'd like, you can follow us and our projects using the links below! :)

Caleb's Instagram: hiaponixon 
Brittany's Instagram: britthouchins

Thank you so much for your support!

~ Caleb and Brittany

What It's About

Our idea is about making ""the walking dead"" silicone usb flash drive bracelets. As there is a lot of fans that watches it and want to have some accessories that shows what they like to watch. We want to make not just a simple bracelet but with a flash drive inside it for people to store their information and when needed to have it on their arm. It will have storage from 128mb up to 16gb. But we need your help to start making this to become real and on our hands!


What You Get

We’re asking for contributions to fund our project and receive the product we are talking about! You can also fund us without receiving anything and that money will be left for other future accessories for ""the walking dead"".
Please understand that when you are donating money the price includes making the bracelets and shipping them. All left over money will be used for future campaign. Thank you.

After the campaign ends we will start to make the bracelets for all the funders.
Making them will take around 5-10 working days. After that every bracelet will be shipped to you. You should get it in around 10-20 working days.

1$ - Big thank you.
5$ - 128mb bracelet.
7$ - 256mb bracelet.
9$ - 4gb bracelet.
12$ - 8gb bracelet.
15$ - 16gb bracelet.
50$ - Secret fan bundle! ( With bracelet and secret items just for your special support ) LIMITED TO ONLY 25!

​KlikR is a small Bluetooth product that can be stuck onto or right next to any infrared remote controlled electronic product, making it almost instantly controllable from your Android or iPhone.

KlikR currently comes in two colors, Onyx and Pearl. If you have ideas for colors, please suggest them in the comments!

The KlikR next app was designed to put experience first. Combining stunning graphics with flat design, our Android and iOS apps will revolutionize your experience.

The KlikR mobile applications allow you to organize all of your devices in your home, room by room. Using the app, you can then navigate through your remote controls in each room by swiping or by selecting from a horizontal list. If you want your family or friends to use KlikR, there's no need for them to set it up again. Simply share your setup with a QR code from the application's home screen. Furthermore, all your setup and devices are backed up on the cloud in case you lose or change your phone. Finally, KlikR is more than a universal remote. KlikR comes equipped with voice control so you can give commands directly to your smartphone. For example you can instruct the app to ""Turn on the TV"" or ""Change the channel"". KlikR also has optional smart pausing and muting in case you get a phone call while you are watching a movie.

KlikR is compatible with almost any infra-red operated device. These commonly include: TV, Air-Conditioner, Blu-Ray, Apple TV, Roku, Cable Box, Set-up-box , DVD, Satellite Receiver, HiFi Systems, Speaker, Sound Bar and Video Projector.

With patent pending technology, KlikR brings advanced technology to your fingertips and creates an unparalleled user experience.

FAQ

What types of devices can I control with KLIKR?

KLIKR is designed to operate any infrared remote controlled device. That includes Televisions, DVD players, BluRay DVD, DVD recorders, Video recorders, Cable boxes, Apple TV, Set Top boxes, Satellite receivers, Audio systems, HiFi systems, Air conditioners (including window types, through-wall types and portable types), Fans, Air purifiers, Dehumidifiers and in general, most devices which include an infrared remote control and built-in infrared receiver.

If my device front panel is too thin, can I still use KLIKR?

KLIKR should be stuck on the device’s front panel, next to the Infrared receiver. When space is limited, KLIKR can be just be placed in front of the device, for instance on the furniture supporting the device. It can also be positioned as far as 4 meters, or 13 feet, away from the device and pointing towards the device.

How do I stick KLIKR?

“KLIKR comes with a double-sided adhesive reusable gel pads (and an extra one for spare). One side of the pad gently sticks itself under KLIKR and the other side sticks reliably to any surface, but can be smoothly removed without leaving any trace on your appliance’s surface. All you need to do is stick KLIKR on the front panel of your device with the lens of the KLIKR directed towards the infrared receiver of the device.

Can one KLIKR control multiple devices?   

One KLIKR can only control one device.

Can I control multiple devices with my KLIKR application?

Yes! That is precisely one of the main advantages of using KLIKR. Once you have stuck and set up your various KlikRs on a number of devices in your home (as well as at our office or at your holiday home), you can operate them all from a unique dashboard in your application, switching from room to room on the home screen and swiping from device to device. It’s that easy and you have all your remotes under the same application.

Can I control my home devices from outside my home?   

Sorry, it is not possible. KLIKR is a proximity device, operating with Bluetooth protocols. It is meant for you to operate your television, audio systems, air conditioners and other devices, when you are at home.

Can I still use my old remote control with KLIKR?   

Your old remote can be operated alongside KLIKR.   

How easy is it to set up KlikR?

Setting up KLIKR is intuitive, easy and fast.

As there is a vast array of audio / video devices, we believe that drawing and testing sets of codes from a database actually takes longer than just learning the codes from your old remote control. The application guides the user through a few steps of key clicks on the old remote directed towards KLIKR. The learning process takes around one minute. We use data base codes however for some video streaming devices (such as Apple TV) as these devices are extremely common. We also use data base codes for air conditioners, as these appliances operate with complex strings of infrared codes, which cannot be learnt.

What if my air conditioner code is not listed in KLIKR database?   

We believe that our database lists a large selection of most air conditioners models on the market, covering the top 20 brand names and growing. If your air conditioner is not included in the list, please write to us through the App or through our website.

What if I have lost my old remote control?   

KLIKR is not meant to replace your old remotes but to enhance your user experience when controlling home devices. Still you can use KLIKR to replace a lost streaming device or air conditioner infrared remote control.

What types of remote controlled devices cannot be operated with KLIKR?   

KLIKR works with devices which receive infrared signals. This excludes remote controlled garage doors and car doors, whose remote controls function with radio frequency (RF).   

How do I share my KLIKR with family and friends?   

Once you and another person have downloaded the mobile application, through our share feature you can generate a QR code (Quick Response code, or optical readable matrix bar code) from the home screen in the application, which the recipient can scan with the inbuilt QR code receiver also in the home screen. You can choose to share device controls by rooms, or for the whole house. In effect, sharing all your home remote controls takes a few seconds.

How does the smart feature work?   

When you receive a phone call, KLIKR will automatically MUTE or PAUSE any controlled device equipped with these features, and will resume the device’s normal function once the phone call is ended. The smart feature can be set to default through the Settings section of the app.

How does the voice control work?   

You can use the voice control button from most screens in the application. It requires 3 parameters: the action, the device name and the room in which the device is located. Sometimes, up to 2 of these parameters can be inferred by the application. For instance, if you only have one TV in your house, saying, “Turn on the TV” will be sufficient. If you are already using the TV remote control, the “Volume up” command will be enough to increase the volume on your TV. Generally, KLIKR is designed with an intelligent algorithm, which will best interpret your commands based on your location, your registered devices as well as the control screen that you use.  So far the voice control supports English but more languages are coming soon.

What happens when I get a new mobile phone?   

You can save your codes on the cloud. When you get a new phone, you just log into your account from the application, and all your rooms and devices are still there for you to control, in the same way as before.

How long does my KLIKR battery last?   

KLIKR is equipped with a battery, which can provide up to eight months of standby mode. Depending on the intensity of the usage with your device, you can operate KLIKR for around four to six months. We have calculated that for an average of 100 clicks per day, you will be able to use KLIKR for around 160 days. That means that a KLIKR used on an air conditioner will usually last up to 6 to 8 months, while a KLIKR used on a television set will probably last around 4 to 5 months. Once the battery is depleted you can simply change the battery and your KlikR will continue to work as usual.

How do I change the battery?   

You can change the battery inside KLIKR just by sliding open the battery door on the top of the KLIKR cover, pulling out the battery tray, and putting a new standard cell battery inside.

Do I have to manually reconnect to my devices?   

No. The application remembers the unique ID of the KLIKR. It automatically and almost instantly reconnects you when you come within range of KLIKR, provided your smartphone Bluetooth is set to ON.

Should I be concerned about the Bluetooth impact on my smartphone battery consumption?   

No. The latest smartphones use Bluetooth 4.0, which uses very little battery.

What are my smartphone requirement to use Klikr?

Syncing to mobile devices requires Bluetooth 4.0 wireless technology, iPhone 4S and later models, or leading Android phones.
