column1: Beautifully designed power docking station provides a solid foundation for your iPhone and Apple Watch featuring a multifunctional Smart LED Lamp.
Solid Anodized Aluminium body and a strong Polycarbonate housing. Finished in a soft-touch rubber coat.
Our touch sensitive control allows you to adjust the brightness of the LED light as well as offering automatic 1 Hour Sleep Mode
Three integrated USB charging ports for the iPhone, Apple Watch and additional port at the back to charge any other USB Devices such as your iPad or Kindle.
Fully adjustable, charge your iPhone without the hassle of removing your protected case or Mophie Juice Pack battery case.
Unobstructed Audio Jack, Speaker and Microphone, perfect for FACETIME or SKYPE calls. Play MUSIC right from the NuDock™

Simple and quick installation, while the non-slip rubber base keeps your devices firmly in place. Integrated cable management system keeping cables neatly hidden for a clutter-free space with instant charging.
Compact, portable keychain backup battery solution with an integrated Apple® MFI Lightning Cable and convenient detachable keyring means you’re always ready for instant power on-the-go.
Latest CSR Bluetooth Smart Chipset allowing low energy connectivity for locating your Keys or iPhone just in case you have misplaced them on the go with a 100FT proximity range.
Take pictures wirelessly! NO iOS APP is required for this.
Instantly disconnect NuKi™ from your keychain to charge your iPhone or re-charge.
NuKi™ Portable Battery instantly charges in the NuDock™ Power Station Lamp, as well as in the included magnetic Portable Dock, effortless power.
Simply connect the dock to a computer or a USB wall charger
Emergency charging on the go! Includes discreet micro USB port.
Enables pass through charging so power is sent to your device first, then NuKi™ Portable Battery recharges.
Beautifully designed Aluminium Apple Watch Charging Stand, simply insert the charging cable in the secure docking port for instant charging in style!
The base has a  EVA Microscopic Suction Pad that will work multiple times and is washable providing a strong hold allowing you complete stability when charging.
As professionals in design and product development with a wealth of experience in these types of product categories you can expect us to deliver a premium product in a timely manner.
For further information about who we are please do visit mitagg.com Please feel free to contact us for any support, we’d love to hear from you! hello@mitagg.com
Can I undock my iPhone from the NuDock with one hand? Yes.
Do I have to remove my iPhone protected case to use NuDock? No, it is compatible to Protected Cases.
Can i use NuDock if I have the Apple iPhone 6 or 6 Plus case installed on my device? Yes the NuDock is fully compatible to the official Apple cases.
Do I have to remove my Mophie Juice Pack battery case to use NuDock? No, it is compatible to the Mophie Juice Pack iPhone Battery Cases for iPhone 5 and iPhone 6 models.
Is NuDock compatible to the Otterbox Defender Case? Yes the NuDock is compatible to the Otterbox Defender Case.
Can i use my iPad Mini with the NuDock? Yes you can use your iPad Mini to charge with nearly any case.
Can i use my iPod Touch with the NuDock? Yes you can use your iPod Touch with nearly any case.

Does the NuDock block my iPhone Microphone or Speakers? No, sound will not be blocked or distorted. Having the iPhone, iPad or iPod elevated on the NuDock means your audio will perform just like Apple intended them too.
Does NuDock block access to the headphone jack on my iPhone? No, the iPhone is elevated so there is access to the headphone jack.

Can I use different brand cables than Apple? No, NuDock is designed to work with the original Apple Lightning Cable and Apple Watch Charging Cable that was included in the box. Our Adjustable Clips fit perfectly with them.

Can i use NuDock with my iPhone 4/4S? No it is designed to work exclusively with Apple’s Lightning Cable, which means it is compatible with iPhone 5, iPhone 5s, iPhone 5c, iPod Touch (5th generation) and iPad Mini only.

Why did you use 1,800 mAh for the NuKi Portable Battery? We do not believe emergency power solutions lower than this specification is convenient. The iPhone 6 Plus has a larger battery and we believe up to 50% extra battery is necessary to keep you going until late evening time.
Where do you make the products? They are assembled in China.

When are the perks expected to ship? We will fulfill perks in the order they are received. We are aiming to start fulfilment mid June 2015 and it is our goal to ship to all our backers by July 2015. We will keep our backers informed of our expected delivery timeframes as we get more information during production.
What is the Warranty? We provide a one (1) year limited warranty. We guarantee you receive your MiTagg Product free of manufacturing defects. We will have 100% AQL inspection levels.

Can I change or cancel my perk? Indiegogo policy dictates that campaign owners have no ability to adjust perk selections. That means we cannot upgrade your perk, we cannot change your perk and we cannot cancel your perk. Please note that contributions made on indiegogo are also non-refundable.
Where do I pay for shipping? Shipping costs are added in the additional donation field when you back the campaign as well as in the perks (Shipping Add-On) if you missed it.

How is shipping handled? We will be shipping via the United States Postal Service First Class mail with delivery tracking confirmation. International shipments will be sent via International First Class.
How much is shipping and handling? Shipping and handling, which includes shipping the items to our offices, packing and fulfilling orders will cost:$25 for All Orders

column1:
0,"

Is there a place for ""toys"" in industrial automation?
• Have you ever tried to find a versatile device to collect data from sensors and devices and process it locally? Or store it on a database server?
• Have you ever struggled with simply too many communication protocol gateways or data bridges?
• Have you ever wished to have a compact programmable device fitting both in your mini-project and your restricted budget?
• Have you ever thought about using the Raspberry Pi minicomputer in an industrial environment?

Well we have. All the questions above are based on our very own experience. As a group of control engineers at REX Controls we have tackled such challenges many times. We have come to a conclusion that although the Raspberry Pi minicomputer is a toy (a fun toy and a real game-changer in many fields, but still a toy from the industrial automation point of view), it definitely has a place in the world of PLCs, PACs, IPCs, especially in the era of IoT and Industry 4.0.

With this campaign, we would like to validate our opinion and we'd be thrilled if you joined us on our way and supported our new hardware product.

Yes, but they must be dressed properly for the occasion!

Our journey with Raspberry Pi started the day it was introduced to the market. As a company focused on advanced automation and control solutions, we strongly believe in the power of fine-tuned control algorithms and the importance of minimizing their computational demands. So wouldn’t it be nice to demonstrate what we can squeeze out of the Raspberry Pi? Yes it would!

We started using the Raspberry Pi as a demonstration platform and as an experimental gadget for students of automation and control system theory. Later on also as a programmable controller for several hobby and DIY projects. Slowly but inevitably we started to think about using it also in industrial applications. We have been so excited about its potential however we have faced several problems:
• 5 VDC power supply is not very common in industrial automation, not mentioning the microUSB power supply connector.
• There was no enclosure nor DIN-rail mount for the Raspberry Pi available.
• There were no add-on boards with analog inputs and outputs to interface with standard industrial sensors and devices.

Let's get dressed!

Nowadays there are products more or less solving the mentioned problems, but neither of those is equipped with analog I/O which would meet our expectations. And neither of those is compliant with the Raspberry Pi HAT specification (set of rules for designing Raspberry Pi add-ons).

Therefore we finally decided to design our own add-on board and enclosure for the Raspberry Pi to dress it properly for the occasion.

Those are the applications we had in mind when we designed the add-on board which we call the Monarco HAT.

What can I interface the Monarco HAT with?
• Frequency inverters, servo drives, heat pumps, chillers and all other devices with 0-10 V inputs
• Distance sensors, level meters, pressure sensors, flow meters and all other devices with 0-10 V or 0/4-20 mA output
• Any PLC via digital or analog I/O
• RS-485 devices (remote I/O, servo drives, etc.) and PLCs supporting Modbus RTU protocol
Plus you can always use the Ethernet connectivity of the Raspberry Pi itself to connect to:
• OMRON PLCs with FINS protocol over Ethernet
• Any other device supporting TCP/IP or UDP/IP communication

column31:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">

Wiring examples are included in the hardware specification of the Monarco HAT.

Any combination is possible!

Yes, you are right. With Monarco HAT you'll be able to:

column1: • Read data from sensors and store it in a database or push it to cloud services.
• Collect data about productivity of machines at your factory.
• Pass 1-Wire sensor data to PLCs. Have you ever thought about using DS18B20 temperature sensors with your Siemens LOGO! or even S7-300 / 400 / 1200 / 1500?
• Create wired or Wi-Fi bridge for analog and digital signals.
• Read data from conventional USB joystick and convert it into 0-10 V analog signals.
• Control energy consumption according to solar activity or power distribution plan.
• Implement a zone controller for a building.
• Set yourself free from limitations of your current PLC, PAC, DCS or any other ""box"" which is not flexible enough for your project. Simply extend its functionality.
• Multiply the number of inputs and outputs of the Monarco HAT. There are dozens of Modbus I/O units (RS-485, TCP) in the market.

As seen on


 

What are the technical specifications of the Monarco HAT?

Full hardware reference manual is available. In short, the following features are available on the Monarco HAT:
Power supply: 10-30 VDC, powers also the Raspberry Pi

4x digital IN, 10-30 VDC, optical isolation, common GND
  • 2x counter (pulse/DIR) or 2x encoder (A/B), up to 200 kHz
4x digital OUT, open-drain, max 40 V, 1 A per channel continuous
2x analog OUT, 0-10 V, 0.5 ms settling time, 12-bit
9 LED indicators, by default mapped as digital inputs and outputs and system status indicators, user controllable
Battery-backed RTC chip for keeping the track of time
Hardware watchdog for power-cycling the Raspberry Pi in case of failure
• Conforms to Raspberry Pi HAT specification, compatible with Raspberry Pi A+, B+, 2 and 3
• Compatible with the Raspberry Pi 7“ official touchscreen (onboard connector for powering the display)

Monarco HAT connector pinout

Programming

Our first choice for programming is naturally our flagship and core product, the REX Control System, a family of software products for projects in automation, robotics, data acquisition, process control and feedback control in general.

Although we believe that programming without hand-writing the code is beneficial in many ways, we are by no means pushing potential backers to use our tools and we will provide:
Open source library for the C language.
Complete documentation of the interface so that anyone can develop libraries for additional frameworks and languages (Python, C#, etc.).

Programming in the REX Control System

The REX Control System offers a graphical development environment for programming the algorithms. You can use standard desktop or laptop PC. You create the algorithms from the so-called function blocks. The library includes countless items (timers, comparators, filters, PID controllers and many more).

Benefits of using the REX Control System
• User interface (HMI) for desktop, tablet and smartphone
• REST API for integration with virtually any framework or programming language
• Up to 2 ms sampling rate with standard Raspbian distribution

Is the MCU of the Monarco HAT meant for running my own algorithms?
No, the internal MCU of the Monarco HAT only handles the input and output signals and communicates with the Raspberry Pi, the one and only ""brain"" to run your algorithms.

Why is the shipping to EU countries so expensive?
It covers not only shipping but also VAT. If you are an EU VAT registered business, please contact us directly.

","Is there a place for ""toys"" in industrial automation?
Have you ever tried to find a versatile device to collect data from sensors and devices and process it locally? Or store it on a database server?
Have you ever struggled with simply too many communication protocol gateways or data bridges?
Have you ever wished to have a compact programmable device fitting both in your mini-project and your restricted budget?
Have you ever thought about using the Raspberry Pi minicomputer in an industrial environment?

Well we have. All the questions above are based on our very own experience. As a group of control engineers at REX Controls we have tackled such challenges many times. We have come to a conclusion that although the Raspberry Pi minicomputer is a toy (a fun toy and a real game-changer in many fields, but still a toy from the industrial automation point of view), it definitely has a place in the world of PLCs, PACs, IPCs, especially in the era of IoT and Industry 4.0.With this campaign, we would like to validate our opinion and we'd be thrilled if you joined us on our way and supported our new hardware product.Yes, but they must be dressed properly for the occasion!Our journey with Raspberry Pi started the day it was introduced to the market. As a company focused on advanced automation and control solutions, we strongly believe in the power of fine-tuned control algorithms and the importance of minimizing their computational demands. So wouldn’t it be nice to demonstrate what we can squeeze out of the Raspberry Pi? Yes it would!We started using the Raspberry Pi as a demonstration platform and as an experimental gadget for students of automation and control system theory. Later on also as a programmable controller for several hobby and DIY projects. Slowly but inevitably we started to think about using it also in industrial applications. We have been so excited about its potential however we have faced several problems:
5 VDC power supply is not very common in industrial automation, not mentioning the microUSB power supply connector.
There was no enclosure nor DIN-rail mount for the Raspberry Pi available.
There were no add-on boards with analog inputs and outputs to interface with standard industrial sensors and devices.

Let's get dressed!Nowadays there are products more or less solving the mentioned problems, but neither of those is equipped with analog I/O which would meet our expectations. And neither of those is compliant with the Raspberry Pi HAT specification (set of rules for designing Raspberry Pi add-ons).Therefore we finally decided to design our own add-on board and enclosure for the Raspberry Pi to dress it properly for the occasion.
Reading and archiving data from sensors
Providing communication gateway between various devices
Those are the applications we had in mind when we designed the add-on board which we call the Monarco HAT.What can I interface the Monarco HAT with?
Push buttons, end switches, level detectors
Frequency inverters, servo drives, heat pumps, chillers and all other devices with 0-10 V inputs
Distance sensors, level meters, pressure sensors, flow meters and all other devices with 0-10 V or 0/4-20 mA output
Any PLC via digital or analog I/O
RS-485 devices (remote I/O, servo drives, etc.) and PLCs supporting Modbus RTU protocol
Plus you can always use the Ethernet connectivity of the Raspberry Pi itself to connect to:
Database servers, ERP systems, cloud services
OMRON PLCs with FINS protocol over Ethernet
Modbus TCP devices (remote I/O) and PLCs
Any other device supporting TCP/IP or UDP/IP communication
Wiring examples are included in the hardware specification of the Monarco HAT.Any combination is possible!Yes, you are right. With Monarco HAT you'll be able to:
Read data from sensors and store it in a database or push it to cloud services.
Collect data about productivity of machines at your factory.
Pass 1-Wire sensor data to PLCs. Have you ever thought about using DS18B20 temperature sensors with your Siemens LOGO! or even S7-300 / 400 / 1200 / 1500?
Create wired or Wi-Fi bridge for analog and digital signals.
Read data from conventional USB joystick and convert it into 0-10 V analog signals.
Control energy consumption according to solar activity or power distribution plan.
Implement a zone controller for a building.
Set yourself free from limitations of your current PLC, PAC, DCS or any other ""box"" which is not flexible enough for your project. Simply extend its functionality.
Multiply the number of inputs and outputs of the Monarco HAT. There are dozens of Modbus I/O units (RS-485, TCP) in the market.
As seen on What are the technical specifications of the Monarco HAT?Full hardware reference manual is available. In short, the following features are available on the Monarco HAT:
Power supply: 10-30 VDC, powers also the Raspberry Pi
4x digital IN, 10-30 VDC, optical isolation, common GND2x counter (pulse/DIR) or 2x encoder (A/B), up to 200 kHz
4x digital OUT, open-drain, max 40 V, 1 A per channel continuous
All with up to 100 kHz PWM
protected against overvoltage and reverse polarity
2x analog OUT, 0-10 V, 0.5 ms settling time, 12-bit
9 LED indicators, by default mapped as digital inputs and outputs and system status indicators, user controllable
High quality push-in terminals, detachable connector
Battery-backed RTC chip for keeping the track of time
Hardware watchdog for power-cycling the Raspberry Pi in case of failure
Conforms to Raspberry Pi HAT specification, compatible with Raspberry Pi A+, B+, 2 and 3
Compatible with the Raspberry Pi 7“ official touchscreen (onboard connector for powering the display)

Monarco HAT connector pinoutProgrammingOur first choice for programming is naturally our flagship and core product, the REX Control System, a family of software products for projects in automation, robotics, data acquisition, process control and feedback control in general.Although we believe that programming without hand-writing the code is beneficial in many ways, we are by no means pushing potential backers to use our tools and we will provide:
Open source library for the C language.
Complete documentation of the interface so that anyone can develop libraries for additional frameworks and languages (Python, C#, etc.).

Programming in the REX Control SystemThe REX Control System offers a graphical development environment for programming the algorithms. You can use standard desktop or laptop PC. You create the algorithms from the so-called function blocks. The library includes countless items (timers, comparators, filters, PID controllers and many more).Benefits of using the REX Control System
User interface (HMI) for desktop, tablet and smartphone
Easy integration into business IT infrastructure (ERP/BMS)
REST API for integration with virtually any framework or programming language
Up to 2 ms sampling rate with standard Raspbian distribution

Is the MCU of the Monarco HAT meant for running my own algorithms?No, the internal MCU of the Monarco HAT only handles the input and output signals and communicates with the Raspberry Pi, the one and only ""brain"" to run your algorithms.
Why is the shipping to EU countries so expensive?It covers not only shipping but also VAT. If you are an EU VAT registered business, please contact us directly.
Raspberry Pi is a trademark of the Raspberry Pi Foundation.
1-Wire is a trademark of Maxim Integrated Products, Inc.

Our Goal: Back to Back wins at the Head of the Charles

In 2013, we took the first Australian LTA (Legs, Trunk and Arms) Para Rowing crew to compete in the Head of the Charles Regatta.  In an unprecedented success story for Para Rowing in Australia, our crew travelled half-way around the world and won their event in an almost record time, beating other international representative crews in the process.

But we weren't finished there.

After our success in 2013, we want to go back and defend our title - hopefully winning back to back wins, and taking a shot at the course record in the process.  We're coming back with a mix of new and returning rowers, all of whom have come together with the goal of going 'back to back' in Boston.
Rowing has given many of these Para-
Rowers a new purpose or direction in
their lives. They have overcome their
disabilities and inspired others by their
gives LTA rowers the opportunity to
taking their rowing to the next level.
However, as well as their training, and the challenges of their race, the crew faces an almighty challenge:
column4: ><b>To raise $35,000 to cover the costs of the crew’s travel

column1: and accommodation, regatta entry fees, boat hire fee and

column8:
What You Get

Coming from all over Australia, the crew are training both in their home clubs and coming together for a series of training camps in Sydney.  In addition, the crew will travel to Boston, need to hire a boat and oars, pay regatta entry fees, and purchase uniforms and other material. 

Conservatively, the total costs will be at least $35,000.

However, the crew has been active in their fundraising.  Over $6,000 has been raised to date with the bulk of our fundraising activity occurring over the next few months, of which our indiegogo campaign will be a crucial component (though by no means the only fundraising going on!).  Any amount donated will help to reduce (and hopefully eliminate) the costs to the athletes (the coaches will be paying for their travel) so they can get on and focus on their training.

The crew is incredibly appreciative of any support they receive, which will help them to achieve their goal!

    The Impact

    After last year's win, para-rowing has experienced a huge boom in NSW and in Australia, which has led to increased competition, focus, and, most importantly, wider support and participation for more para athletes.  

    Bringing home a 'back-to-back' win would help to cement Australia's place on the international stage following on from an incredibly successful 2014 International Para-Rowing Regatta in which Australia was the most successful team.  

    Beyond the incredible impact upon the crew directly, your support will help our program to bring forward the next generation of para rowing athletes and, more broadly, increase participation, support, and the standard of para rowing across Australia. 

      Risks &
column9:
Challenges

What are the risks?

Rowing is inherently an expensive sport, but as a community club in the heart of Balmain, NSW, Balmain Rowing Club has always sought to provide access to rowing for all members of the community.  Balmain's Para Rowing Program continues this vision for para athletes but we rely upon your support to for our program to continue.  

If we don't reach our fundraising goals, our crew may not have the money to make it to Boston to compete, and the worst result for the crew would be not even making it to the start line.

Another risk is that we go over and get beaten - but don't worry: our athletes and coaches are doing everything to prepare the crew and collectively our program has won 7 Australian Titles and 3 silver medals at the national level in the last 4 years, 6 State Championships, 8 silver medals and 4 bronze medals at the state level.  

And we will be doing everything possible to prepare our crew for their race.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Maybe you can't contribute right now?  That's ok.  Please:

column1: • Tell your friends about our campaign by sharing this page
Find out more about the crew in our brochure at http://tiny.cc/2014LTAHoTC

And please feel free to contact us for any other questions or queries about our program!

column1:
Where can I get a Mi World™ PCS? 
Mi World™ is slated to begin production in early spring 2014. The first devices will only be available via the Indiegogo campaign.
What Operating system does Mi World™ PCS run?
Initial devices will ship with a customized version of Android. A custom version of Linux will be released as an update.
Can Mi World™ PCS stream content to more than one smart device at the same time?
Yes. Mi World™ PCS can stream the same movie or song or other digital data to all your devices simultaneously.
Can Mi World™ PCS stream different content to more than one smart device at the same time?
Yes. Mi World™ PCS can stream different movies or songs or other digital data to different devices at the same time.
Does Mi World™ PCS connect to the Internet?

Mi World™ PCS works with or without access to the Internet. It creates a local cloud that follows you wherever you go. Mi World™ PCS can also connect to the Internet via Wi-Fi to access remote storage.
Can Mi World™ PCS connect to the Internet and stream to other devices at the same time?
Yes. Mi World™ has Wi-Fi radios and can connect to a Wi-Fi hotspot and broadcast that signal to other devices.
Does Mi World™ PCS have a screen?
No. Mi World™ PCS can be accessed by any smart device (phone, tablet, watch, Google glass, laptop, TV, etc.) or SmartTV with HDMI interface.
I have a smartphone. Why do I need a Mi World™ PCS?

Smartphones are great, but their operating system is not the same as the operating system on the Mi World™ PCS.  In addition, smartphones do not offer the amount of local storage or ability to share/stream files to other devices. Smartphones are not able to make other smart devices more powerful. Mi World™ enables connected devices to share processing cycles (based on device compatibility) with other paired smart devices making the entire wireless ecosystem more powerful (smarter).
How does Mi World™ PCS Connect to Smart Devices?
Both wireless (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and wired (USB). Mi World also has HDMI interface to connect other terminals.
Mi World™ PCS develops relationships with your devices. It only allows interaction between the devices you approve.  You set the level of security for each device. If an unknown device attempts a
connection, Mi World™ PCS rejects the connection.
Does Mi World™ PCS work as a 4G hotspot?
There will be versions of Mi World™ PCS that will act as a Smart LTE hotspot. Myth Innovations is currently talking with different telecommunication companies about offering 4G  connectivity.

What if I lose Mi World™ PCS?Mi World™ PCS can identify its location through GPS and communicate back to the owner where it physically is or you can clear all storage if desired the first time it is connected to an internet connection.  It will not want to connect to any unauthorized device.

column2: >How much storage does Mi World™ PCS have?

column1: Mi World™ PCS has a total of 5 SD card slots available.  There is 1 external full size card slot and 4 internal (must open the case) which includes 1 additional full size and 3 microSD slots.  Mi World™ ships with a base level of 64GB of SD storage. Larger capacity SD cards can be added.  For convenience we will offer models with 64GB, 128GB, 256GB and 512GB shipped with this additional storage.  The memory is user accessible so you can use your own SD cards if you would prefer.
How can I develop apps for Mi World™ PCS?
The SDK will be available to select partners via Indiegogo.
Does Mi World™ PCS work with businesses?

The amount of data being generated in 2014, along with the variety of data, requires businesses to view information almost like a natural resource.  Mi World™ PCS can connect to a corporate network and other devices in a meeting.  Since Mi World™ PCS can run applications, an example might be to display an executive score card during a meeting.  This would allow users to collaborate in a session, building presentations, reviewing situations or conduct a learning session together.
How does Mi World™ PCS contribute as a green device?
It is much smaller than a traditional server, desktop workstation and is battery powered.  Almost everything in the Mi World™ PCS is designed to be recycled.
Can Mi World™ PCS work in a manufacturing environment?
Yes. Mi World™ PCS is a solid state device with no moving parts.

How does Mi World™ PCS work in a classroom?  Can I use it to share with both laptops belonging to my students and their iPhone/mobile android devices all at once?  My class sizes range up to 25 people.

Mi World™ PCS works with any device that connects via standard network protocols (i.e. Wi-Fi or Bluetooth) therefore can probably communicate with any device in the classroom.  If you only share the documents/video it should be OK for a size of 25 class.  If

you are going to allow frequent changes of the documents, i.e. the students need to refresh the documents very often, in this case, you may need more than one Mi World™ PCS to form a mesh network to share the work load.
Does Mi World™ PCS work with Mac?

Mi World™ PCS will connect to any device with Wi-Fi or Bluetooth connection regardless of the OS running on that device.  The core software shipped with Mi World™ PCS will show and share your music, movies, files, etc…  Thus you can use Mi World™ PCS as a hub to connect devices securely or use it as a mobile hot spot that any device can receive and view any file type you wish to share.  Unfortunately, at this time the iOS operating system is restricted to Apple devices and will not run on Mi World™ PCS.  However, Mi World™ PCS will form the unified communications layer with iOS devices which allows not only sharing of information but also processing cycles (based on device compatibility).  You will find having devices connected to Mi World™ PCS will provide additional power without using an external cloud.
I am not super tech savvy, will you be able to provide some handholding support?
We will establish a blog site for all supporters where we will share insights on how to accomplish tasks and share best practice advice.
Is there a version with more RAM?

RAM on our device is limited by our board being used.  The unified communications layer will support leveraging RAM of connected devices (based on device compatibility), however, which can expand RAM beyond the 2 GB RAM on the base board.

Yes. Mi World™ has Wi-Fi radios and can connect to a Wi-Fi hotspot and broadcast that signal to other devices.
Does Mi World™ PCS have a screen?
No. Mi World™ PCS can be accessed by any smart device (phone, tablet, watch, Google glass, laptop, TV, etc.) or SmartTV with HDMI interface.
I have a smartphone. Why do I need a Mi World™ PCS?

Smartphones are great, but their operating system is not the same as the operating system on the Mi World™ PCS.  In addition, smartphones do not offer the amount of local storage or ability to share/stream files to other devices. Smartphones are not able to make other smart devices more powerful. Mi World™ enables connected devices to share processing cycles (based on device compatibility) with other paired smart devices making the entire wireless ecosystem more powerful (smarter).
How does Mi World™ PCS Connect to Smart Devices?
Both wireless (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and wired (USB). Mi World also has HDMI interface to connect other terminals.
Mi World™ PCS develops relationships with your devices. It only allows interaction between the devices you approve.  You set the level of security for each device. If an unknown device attempts a
connection, Mi World™ PCS rejects the connection.
Does Mi World™ PCS work as a 4G hotspot?
There will be versions of Mi World™ PCS that will act as a Smart LTE hotspot. Myth Innovations is currently talking with different telecommunication companies about offering 4G  connectivity.

What if I lose Mi World™ PCS?Mi World™ PCS can identify its location through GPS and communicate back to the owner where it physically is or you can clear all storage if desired the first time it is connected to an internet connection.  It will not want to connect to any unauthorized device.
How much storage does Mi World™ PCS have?

Mi World™ PCS has a total of 5 SD card slots available.  There is 1 external full size card slot and 4 internal (must open the case) which includes 1 additional full size and 3 microSD slots.  Mi World™ ships with a base level of 64GB of SD storage. Larger capacity SD cards can be added.  For convenience we will offer models with 64GB, 128GB, 256GB and 512GB shipped with this additional storage.  The memory is user accessible so you can use your own SD cards if you would prefer.
How can I develop apps for Mi World™ PCS?
The SDK will be available to select partners via Indiegogo.
Does Mi World™ PCS work with businesses?

The amount of data being generated in 2014, along with the variety of data, requires businesses to view information almost like a natural resource.  Mi World™ PCS can connect to a corporate network and other devices in a meeting.  Since Mi World™ PCS can run applications, an example might be to display an executive score card during a meeting.  This would allow users to collaborate in a session, building presentations, reviewing situations or conduct a learning session together.
How does Mi World™ PCS contribute as a green device?
It is much smaller than a traditional server, desktop workstation and is battery powered.  Almost everything in the Mi World™ PCS is designed to be recycled.
Can Mi World™ PCS work in a manufacturing environment?
Yes. Mi World™ PCS is a solid state device with no moving parts.

How does Mi World™ PCS work in a classroom?  Can I use it to share with both laptops belonging to my students and their iPhone/mobile android devices all at once?  My class sizes range up to 25 people.

Mi World™ PCS works with any device that connects via standard network protocols (i.e. Wi-Fi or Bluetooth) therefore can probably communicate with any device in the classroom.  If you only share the documents/video it should be OK for a size of 25 class.  If

you are going to allow frequent changes of the documents, i.e. the students need to refresh the documents very often, in this case, you may need more than one Mi World™ PCS to form a mesh network to share the work load.
Does Mi World™ PCS work with Mac?

Mi World™ PCS will connect to any device with Wi-Fi or Bluetooth connection regardless of the OS running on that device.  The core software shipped with Mi World™ PCS will show and share your music, movies, files, etc…  Thus you can use Mi World™ PCS as a hub to connect devices securely or use it as a mobile hot spot that any device can receive and view any file type you wish to share.  Unfortunately, at this time the iOS operating system is restricted to Apple devices and will not run on Mi World™ PCS.  However, Mi World™ PCS will form the unified communications layer with iOS devices which allows not only sharing of information but also processing cycles (based on device compatibility).  You will find having devices connected to Mi World™ PCS will provide additional power without using an external cloud.
I am not super tech savvy, will you be able to provide some handholding support?
We will establish a blog site for all supporters where we will share insights on how to accomplish tasks and share best practice advice.
Is there a version with more RAM?

RAM on our device is limited by our board being used.  The unified communications layer will support leveraging RAM of connected devices (based on device compatibility), however, which can expand RAM beyond the 2 GB RAM on the base board.",11.0,3,"1 Campaign

When I came across assisting the Digital Circuits course at Universidad de Costa Rica, I realised the urge of having a simple, portable, all-in-one device that let's students get into prototyping quickly, so that's when the idea of the smartyboard was born.

Even if you are a hobbyist or a professional the smartyboard does everything you need right out of the box, it does power it's rails from a micro-usb port, so you can connect your phone charger or any usb power source, it gan generate signals such as, square wave, servo movements, PMW. Also it can also work as a simple oscilloscope when connected to an Android device with usb host support, or your personal computer, yes you can power your circuits from your computer, and most tablets and phones, this makes this breadboard truly portable.

No more messy and bulky power sources, reduce the amount of components and save space and money, it fits in your pocket, don't buy an arduino for every prototype you make, just use the signal generator or program the board and swap your mini breadboard with another project.

Our first goal is to have our first and second batch of smartyboards and release the free Android app for signal generation and readings. If the goal is not reached we may decide to refund every cent or still make the few devices. After the goal is reached, we are going to plan more batches and we have stablished a few more goals in the following order:

• Develop the desktop version: even the first batch is able to power the circuits from usb, but the desktop software will enable windows users (linux and osx pending so far) to control the generator and oscilloscope.
• Improve the mobile version with more advanced features, improved UI, performance, and features.
• Extend compatibility to more platforms, such iOS, OSX, and linux computers.
• We will design with a compact detachable drawer so you carry your components with your smartyboard.

The first batch will be very small and is already in production, the first supporters will get it much faster, the second batch might be split in several mini-batches so we can ship them as soon as every device is ready.
For every 15 $3 contribution we will donate a smartyboard to a costa rican student that can't afford electronics equipment. Your name will appear in our credits.

If you donate $45/$35 you get one kit, it includes the smartyboard itself with one removable mini breadboard, magnetic usb cable, jumper wires, and assorted electronic components including instructions for making your first project in your smartyboard. Access to the SmartyBoard Studio App will be free.
If you donate $35 or more you will get a space in our sponsors section in our website and mobile app. You can specify a link to your website.

Impact

This kit not only works as a great startup kit but also as a super compact prototyping device for experienced makers. I have taught the digital circuits laboratory course for computer science at University of Costa Rica several times as assistant, and this made me aware that there were no starter kits that fit their needs, we always had to deal with unecesarily big power sources and connectors incompatibility.

Riesgos y desafíos

At this time we only have one 3D printer and the second one is on it's way, so in the worst case scenario there may be delays if we receive very large orders, but we already built prototypes that work very well.

Help us spread the word

Please share this project with your friends on social networks or notify your university or favorite newspaper about this project, we belive that this project has enough potential to become a mass produced product that will facilitate the way people learn electronics.

column3: >Badge Fever helps save our achievements from fading away by providing a <strong style=""color: #f05722
column5: >universal global solution for Badges and Badge systems.

column2: >Collect Badges Everywhere, Manage Them in One Place!

column1: Have you ever won a football championship? Have you ever taken Chinese cooking class? Or supported a charity? Those are all achievements people make on a daily basis. Unfortunately most of these achievements fade away over time.
What if you could store and manage all your achievements at one global place? You can!

With Badge Fever, all your achievements, no matter how small or large, are stored in one global and secure place. You have full control over what Badges are displayed (as well as when and where they’re displayed). Badge Fever respects your privacy!

As a matter of fact, you have probably already collected a few Badges and aren’t even aware of it. But don't worry. None of your Badges are visible to the public unless you register with Badge Fever and choose to display your Badges publicly.

column2:
>Do you feel like you are up for the challenge?
Head to http://badgefever.com and get started!
>Become a Badge Master and Challenge the World!

column1: Do you have a base of users you want to reward? Do you want your community to be recognized? Or do you just have a cool idea that can challenge people?

With our Badge Master module, you are just few clicks from challenging the world. All you have to do is register with Badge Fever, access the Badge Master module and fill in all the needed information about your badge, such as images, description, requirements and more. Each badge can have up to 10 Levels!
Wondering how long does it take? Watch our tutorial video and see that Create, Reward and Display badge can take less than 10 minutes!

column2: target=""_blank"" title=""Watch: Create, Reward and Display Badge in under 10 minutes! "">Watch: Create, Reward and Display Badge in under 10 minutes!

column1: Creating Badges is free for individuals (limited assignments) and non-profit organizations!
Have you been thinking about implementing a badge system on your website? Don't waste your time and resources - let Badge Fever do the hard work!

With the Badge Fever API, you can manage and assign your Badges remotely. No longer are you required to be a super- skilled developer, manage huge databases or spend hours behind the whiteboard. With Badge Fever, you can setup your badge system in just three steps!
Create Badge Fever App - Authorize your website to Badge Fever API.
Create Badges - As simple as filling out a form. Each badge can have up to 10 levels!

Implement Badge Fever SDK on your website - Badge Fever SDK is an Open Source library available in several programming languages to ensure the easiest possible integration of Badge Fever. Various plugins and extensions for popular CMS systems are also available.

With the simple Badge Fever setup process, you can relax and concentrate on your business or hobbies while you let Badge Fever take care of the rest! As a bonus, your Badges will become part of the global environment and your badge will be visible to millions of people every day!

Implementing Badge Fever into websites, portals, CVs and other media is easy and fast. Developers can take advantage of one of the Badge Fever libraries, plugins and extensions for popular systems such as Wordpress, or create their own implementation via our swift API.
Developers are not only able display Badges, but can also manage Badges remotely.
Integrate Badge Fever into your system and discover new ways to interact with your users!

Badge Fever is still in its early stage and some of the elements above have yet to be implemented. With your help, we will be able to speed up the process, and create awesome services which will be beneficial for everyone!
If we raise our goal of $20,000 USD, we will be able to:
• Expand our team with a developer and social director.
• Improve our servers and make sure that Badge Fever is as fast as possible.
• We will create a solid design and branding to support the Badge Fever project.
• And many other small improvements will be made around the whole Badge Fever website.

We have also many plans for stretched goals in case our campaign can rise more money than our goal. Your contribution will never get lost and we will make sure that all contributions will be spend on the growth of Badge Fever project.
What do we have to offer in reward?
Everyone who contributes to the Badge Fever project earns our utmost respect and appreciation!
Apart from the feeling that you have helped to raise an awesome project, we also have some goodies prepared for you.

column3: />We will be giving away some Badge Fever items such as T-shirts, bracelets, Badges, buttons, hand-made cookies and other promotional items.

column1: For bigger contributions you will be also rewarded with free Badge Master accounts to get you started with the badge implementation process on your systems.

Badge is a visual representation of an achievement of any kind. Badges are not made only from images but also metadata which is provided together with the image. Various metadata is included such as badge title, level, level title, date of achievement and more.

Badge Fever is a global web service and universal solution for Badge systems. Badge Fever is a complete solution for all parties. While companies can create their badges in Badge Fever system, users can collect badges and developers can displays badges through Badge Fever. All of the users’ achievements can be shared directly to all popular social networks. With Badge Fever, a user can manage all of his or her achievements in one place and will be recognized for achievements that would otherwise fade over time.

Anyone can become a Badge Master and create badges. Mainly badges come from such sources as online communities, traditional and online educational institutions, companies and organizations that employ people, educational networks, non-profit organizations and so on.
What if I don’t want to display all Badges?

As a user, you can find all achievements stored in one place and you will have full control over them. Users can manage which badges to accept or reject, which badges to display or hide, where and when to display the badges.

Badge Fever is currently located in Asia and therefore we will require you to contribute $10 for international postage (all countries other than China and Hong Kong). The package will be delivered directly to provided address. If you did not include postage in the price of perk, you will be able to do so later on.

Never be without power again. The power to fully charge your phone twice, in the palm of your hand.

Magic Beans

The Magic Bean is definitely not one of the Worlds Smallest chargers.  However it is one of the most effective ones for it's size.  Using Samsung battery cells, this little bean is rated at 5200mAh.  To give you an idea of the capacity.  Open up your phone's case and inspect the battery.  The mAh should be printed on the battery.  The Samsung Galaxy 3 uses a battery of 2100mAh.  Which means you are able to charge your phone to full capacity, TWICE.  No wonder we named it the Magic Beans.

Samsung Battery Cells

Currently we have a contract with Samsung to use their battery cells to make the Magic Beans.  We chose a reputable company like Samsung over the cheaper and lower cost Chinese alternatives.  These cells are fully rechargeable and not a one time use item.  They are designed to be used on a daily basis or as an emergency backup .  Fully charged, the Magic Bean loses 10% of it's charge every 3 month.  So even if it's left alone for a year, you will still have enough power to fully charge your 2100mAh battery.  Quality is our priority.  

Design of the Bean

Our Market Research shows that women use their cell phones for photos and social media sites more than men.  Which means their batteries depletes faster.  We wanted to design something cute for women that can fit easily into a purse or pocket book. But also sleek and small enough for men that it won't create a bulk in your front pocket.   Currently we have 6 colors in development.  Orange, Pink, Blue, Green, Yellow, and Black.  

How it works

Charge up the Magic Bean from the supplied cable or any AC micro-usb wall plug. Then just put it in your pocket or in your car and forget about it. To Use: Turn the power switch on and plug into your phone, the same as you would your charger. Your phone will start to recharge automatically.

Micro-USB is the standard charging connector for all phones apart from iPhone. so you can charge almost any Android, Samsung, LG, Sony, Motorola, Nokia or Blackberry phone.  Adapters are available for the iphone 4 and iphone 5.

Funding

Where we need you to come in is to help us raise funds to put the Magic Beans into it's first production run and pay for all the certification like CE, RoHS,FCC and WEEE.  Any electronic product, especially batteries need FCC and RoHS certification that run into the thousands.  Our engineers have guaranteed us that it will pass the necessary inspections.  We have set up some rewards for backers that help us bring the Magic Beans to market.  Thanks for watching

Risks and Challenges

Any technology project will carry certain risks, and surprises can occur at any point in a project. 
We have done our best to mitigate and minimize the risks associated to bringing the Magic Beans to market in several ways: 

- We have well tested and working prototypes. I started this project with my friend who works as an engineer for Epson. Through his company, we have used reputable manufacturing factories that have worked with Epson for over 10 years. Through them, we will less likely meet any problems that occur with other less reputable manufactures.

If you will help me, I I'll be happy! Thank you!KissNanà",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

(skip to ""CableKnife..."" if you don't want my life story!)

With a young family to look after I wanted to use my engineering skills to create some income while the children were at school. I couldn't take a full time job because of the relatively short school hours.

My family had made several trips to Germany and the Netherlands and had always admired the tricycles with the cargo box on the front for the children to sit in. We considered buying one but were put off by the price.  They were over £2,500.  We parked that idea.

column2: >
column7:
s=099611cd86249c109b16af447136808e"" src="""" style=""""/> 

On our return from the last trip I couldn't get the trikes out of my mind.  I was a competent Welder and Machinist.  I was confident on being able to make a trike.

I sourced all of the materials, bought a TIG welder and a Colchester Lathe and set to work. The trikes have a pair of very substantial hubs on the front wheels that have a brake disc attached to each. These are not commercially available.  Some people have adapted wheelchair hubs for this purpose but I wanted something custom built for the job.


The Hubs...

I designed and turned a pair of hubs that would be suitable.  We then had a second child...

The trike in current design would not be big enough for our larger family.  I redesigned the trike but this also meant that I would need new hubs.

Not wanting to waste the hubs I had made I decided to list them on eBay.  I got so many bids for them from people who were making their own projects that I could have sold them ten times over!

I put the trike to one side for the next few months and made hundreds of pairs of hubs, custom-made to customer specifications.

Eventually I had to make time for the trike as the children were pestering me to take them out on it.

I needed a tube bender to bend the chrome-moly steel tubing. Not wanting to pay as much for a bender as a trike would cost, I built my own but I needed three different sized dies for the different tubing that the bike was made from.  There are commercially available dies but the company that sold them wouldn't sell them to me as I hadn't bought a bender from them...
column8: >
column13:
s=4b027f467850455ec6f331f33097a9bf"" src="""" style=""""/> 


The Dies...

I decided that I had to make my own dies.  To do this I would have to turn a concave form on my lathe.  Manual lathes are great at turning along straight lines and angles but one thing that they don't do very well is curves. This is done in industry by using a computer controlled (CNC) lathe.  I didn't have a CNC lathe...

There are attachments that can go on a lathe to create radii but being in four figures they were well out of my budget.

There was only one thing for it!  I had to make my own attachment...


The Attachment...

It took three months to perfect the design.  It would not only create concave radii but also convex.  I had spent quite a lot of my trike budget on this attachment so I made an additional five to try to recoup some of this investment.  They sold on eBay in a couple of days.

I put the trike to one side and spent the next eighteen months making tool after tool to sell. The product became so successful that it reached a level that I couldn't supply enough by just machining the tool myself.  I sold my lathe, mill and welder and invested the money into getting a batch of tools machined abroad.  I assembled the tool in the UK as I wanted to own the quality control.

I succeeded in getting the tool into a retailer in the UK and also one in the USA.
column14: >
column19:
s=f1b7cc12a3482fe75d1ff0da3cffd20f"" src="""" style=""""/> 

As I was no longer machining the tools myself I had jigs and fittings that were taking up space in my garage (workshop/office &
column20:
factory!).  I took them to the local scrap yard to weigh them in for cash.

While I was at the scrap yard I saw two huge skips.  One contained bright copper wire and the other contained PVC coated wire.

I got into a conversation with the chap working there and asked him why one had been stripped and the other hadn't.  He told me that the coated wire was only still coated because the people who had cashed it in didn't have the tools to remove the insulation.


Strippers...

This was a light bulb moment for me.  As soon as he told me that the stripped cable was bought for three times the cost of the coated cable I thought that I could buy the coated cable from him, strip it and, cash it in.

I searched and searched for methods of stripping the cable.  There are huge expensive industrial machines that you can buy and tools that you have to attach to a drill in order to operate it.  I was looking for something self-standing, handheld and portable. 

I found a couple but they had utility knife blades that were exposed to the user and looked lethal.  There was no way that they were a viable tool.

I wanted to be able to strip all cables that you would find in a house or domestic situation.  The majority of the unstripped cable that I was going to buy had come from the domestic environment, including flat ""Twin and Earth"" type cables.  None of the strippers that I had found would handle flat cables.

I would have to build my own...


CableKnife...

There were several considerations that I had when designing CableKnife.

The tool had to fit the following specification
column21:
Types of Cable - I had searched every type of tool that claims to strip insulation from cable, from the small homemade lethal tools up to the large industrial machines. They all had one thing in common - none of them would strip every type of cable that a domestic installer would use.  Some would only strip the smaller diameter cables and others would only handle the larger capacity cables.

I wanted to make a tool that would strip everything from 1mm∅ cable up to something as large as a 20mm∅ cable that a DIY'er might find on a car battery system or an old welder they were breaking down for scrap.

There is another issue of flat cables.  Every house has flat cables in it, from 1mm² cables for lighting circuits up to 16mm² 70 Amp Twin &
column22:
Earth cables that would be found on an electric shower or cooker circuit. 

They all had to be stripped using the same tool, without the need to adjust any screws or clamps each time the user wanted to strip a different size cable. 

Cutting Device - The ""other"" strippers used proprietary cutting devices such as sharpened wheels or metal spikes with sharp points.  The downside to this is that at 4pm on a Friday afternoon when the Apprentice Electrician is stripping cable and the device goes blunt what can they do? Chances are they will not have bought a spare cutter and will have to purchase a replacement from the manufacturer often at great cost.  Some replacement cutting wheels cost more than the RRP of CableKnife!

I decided that as the utility knife blade is as common as Coke all over the World then the tool must use one as its cutting device.

Portable - The tools which were already on the market that I had seen had many drawbacks. The biggest was their size.  They were either bolted to the floor, a workbench or in a vice. Some even needed to be connected to a power drill or electricity supply in order to work.

When I want to use a knife I don't want to have to put it in a vice or bolt it to the floor.  I want a portable tool.  CableKnife is essentially just a knife with a guide for the cable, that is part of the versatility of CableKnife.  I want to be able to put the tool in my tool box in the back of the van so that when I get a spare few minutes I can strip a couple of KG's of cable and not have to do it in the workshop.

Easy to Use - All of the other tools have either pre-drilled holes for different diameter cables (which limits the cables that can be stripped) or have adjustable rollers that the user changes for each type of cable.  The issue with this is that unless the user has organised their cable to be stripped into size order they will have to adjust the tool every time the strip a length of cable.  I wanted the tool to need no adjustment for every cut.

I spent a few weeks taking measurements of different cables and designing ideas in Solidworks. 

The parts needed to be prototyped accurately as there were tight tolerances that were important to the function of the tool.

3D prototyping is an economic way of reproducing parts for testing purposes, in particular laser sintering is a great balance of economy, accuracy and finish.  All in all, I had over 600 separate parts for the tool. Bearing in mind that the final design of the tool has only 5 parts, it shows just how reliant I was on this fast economic prototyping method.
column28:
s=95dd6fc27f71c8cf779055f3e4fb681c"" src="""" style=""""/> 

Once I had settled on the functional design I had the parts silicone cast. This method produces a part that is almost as accurate and durable as an injection moulded part, therefore allowing me to get coloured plastic parts to test fully for form and function.  These have also been tested to destruction.

One hundred and thirty four prototypes and CableKnife was born!
column29: >
column34:
s=4a637acfdd60d7a2c21a65186c2a96cf"" src="""" style=""""/> 

I never did build that trike...


The Campaign...

What is the campaign for?

This is not our first campaign, we have successfully finished a kickStarter campaign.

We needed £15,000 for production costs. We smashed the target and achieved 202% with over 1200 CableKnife's sold in just 30 days.

We will need a full e commerce website so that we can maximise the sales opportunities that CableKnife generates.

This campaign is purely for the website, the tools are in production so there is no risk of your perks not being delivered.

Every penny that this campaign generates will go towards the website, we have set the target deliberately low as we have to do the website anyway so it all helps!


Timings...

I anticipate that the tool will be available to release to Pledgers at the end of April, early May at the latest.


Your Support...

This is where I really struggle to find the words to describe what your help means to me.  The support that CableKnife has already received from the Social media and web campaigns so far has been incredible. 

When I spent cold evenings in the garage cutting up prototypes and redesigning parts to try and make it work I always believed in this tool. 

I knew there was a market for it but to now get messages from time-served Electricians saying that they have been waiting for 30 years for a tool like this, it really hits home that other people believe in CableKnife too!

Pledgers will not only receive the perks that they have placed a pledge against but each and every one will receive a personal email from me - not a cut and paste newsletter but a personal email.  This is because without pledges I am going to struggle to get this tool to market.

As well as pledging, another way that you can help me is to shout about the Campaign! Below are my Social Media links, please like and share the pages and tell your friends about CableKnife!

column13:
s=e3885cb65c9df671a788c849be7bf31a"" src="""" style=""""/> 


Thank you for taking the time to read about me and CableKnife.


Risks and Challenges...
column17: >Unlike the initial KickStarter campaign this is risk free. Your perks are secure, they are currently being made.
column21: >If you pledge on this campaign, you will get your perk, unlike some campaigns t
column25:
>here is no risk that you will not receive your perks for pledging.

Thank you for your interest in my Project

Let's do this. I've got a trike to build!

From all at CableKnife, Thank You.

MagDock = All-in-one Wireless Charger + Smart Power Bank + Zip-&
column6:
>

 

MagDock is the new ultimate all-in-one wireless charging dock for all your devices, a standby power bank monitored by IoT technology, and a zip-&
column7: -go traveling kit for all the power you need on the go.
column10: >
column14:
>

 

The age of wireless charging is coming. But do we really need it?

column1: You can't watch videos with comfortable view angle when charging with a wireless charging pad.
You may find your phone battery flat in the morning. A slight knock can move your device out of place and stop it charging.
We thought the Apple Airpower would save us until we tried to charge a watch with a linked loop band:
We still believe in wireless charging, but it needs some revolutionary improvements. We wanted something really useful and convenient. So we created MagDock.
The MagDock can charge up to 3 of your devices all at once. A convenient stand for all your devices that dispenses with the mess of cables and the limited USB sockets you may have near you.
The devices that you can charge on MagDock include
The innovative design of a twistable top has taken your standard charging dock, and turned it into a convenient stand for your devices and for you!
The twistable design allows you to adjust it for the best viewing angles you need. You can even facetime with your friends hands-free whilst charging it.

We know that feeling, you find your phone battery still flat after charging over-night on the charging pad. Something unexpected knocked it off from charging area accidentally, the kids, the pet or even you.
With the MagDock, this can’t happen anymore.

Embedded with magnets whilst not interfering with the wireless charging, MagDock auto aligns your phone once being attached on. Your phone would stick on the charging area tightly and being charged continuously.
Without any light indicators, MagDock has no light leakage while charging your devices and is ideal as a nightstand charger and organizer.
Inbuilt with a 7800mAh battery, MagDock is a back-up power bank too. More importantly, MagDock charges itself and it is always ready for your next use. Whenever you need a power bank, it is there.
No matter you're waiting for the flight during your trip:
Or reading the latest work report at Cafe
Or going for a relaxing outdoor adventure, whenever you need it, just grab it and it ensures your device never runs out of power!
Also, the power bank has a large capacity of 7800 mAh, which supports 2 charges of iPhone X or 25 charges of Apple Watch 3.
Note: Inbuilt power bank is available in only MagDock Pro version.
Simplicity is the hidden complexity. With the undirected single-port design, any way you plug in is the right way of charging.
We provide an optional premium travel pouch. So every time you go for a trip, storing your MagDock in the pouch, zip and go. Say goodbye to messy cables when being on the go or fly.
And with the 30W PD adaptor supplied, which charges both MagDock and even laptop, the MagDock is all the power you need for your trip.
MagDock’s companion app keeps track of charging and lets you know whether the device on is charging or not. Available for iOS &
You will be notified if the MagDock battery is low, fully charged, or unplugged from the mains socket accidentally:
The companion APP is available for iOS &
More than one device needs charging? You can always expand the wireless charging for more devices with the additional optional charger pad - MagPad.
MagPad is actually a 10W wireless charger and can be used independently to charge any Qi-compatible devices, including the new AirPods that Apple plans to launch this year.

Stability is reliability. Whether you are attaching or removing devices, you will never have any vibration, moving or sliding of the MagDock. The Nano gel base provides a secure base allowing the MagDock to always stick in the right place.
Note: All 38mm, 40mm, 42mm, 44mm ledges are included in the package.

Hello, thanks for checking out our project :-)

Billsup is a simple tool to track debts and manage shared bills amongst friends. For this campaign, we are building its web application and its Android application, which will allow users to record bills, track payments and debts, and send a reminder to friends.

During college, Anup shared a house with a bunch of roommates. Between rent, daily expenses, and group trips, it became very difficult to keep track of I-owe-you's. Anup found that the existing tools and websites do not have the ease-of-use and flexibility that he wanted, so billsup is being built to help people like Anup - those who want an easy way to keep track of debt and shared bills with friends. Billsup came as a side project for us, and we're building it as a tool to help people like us.

Support us by funding to our project. Depending on how much you contribute, you can choose one of the different rewards at your pledge tier! :-) If you are outside of Canada or US, please add $5 to your pledge to account for shipping costs.
You could also pledge without picking a reward.
How about equity? Can I pledge for a share of the company?

I've been asked this question by multiple people - we really would appreciate your pldeges, but currently we are not considering distributing equity, unless your pledge amount exceeds $10,000 USD - if that's the case, contact us at info@billsup.com. Otherwise, you could still pledge any amount without picking a reward if you do not want any of the rewards.

Our goal of $3000 is actually a very small portion of our operational cost, so it'd be great if we can exceed our goal. The money we do collect will be going directly to making this project happen. So far, we've been using our own time to build the project, and spending our own funds to host the website and various other operations. With your contribution, we would be able to:
• Buy more Android devices to test our application on different platforms
• Spend more time building features that users want
• Pay for part of our operation cost such as domain hosting, various development software and equipment
• Plan and build the tool for other platforms

Even though this has been a side project, we're working hard on completing it, and will be spending a lot more time on it if the campaign is successful.  Our current plan is to complete the web application by the end of June, and the Android application by the end of July.
I'm not from US or Canada, can I still contribute?
Yes, you can contribute from anywhere in the world! Every bit helps, thanks so much for your support!
• Allow users to enter shared bills and debts quickly. The interface would be simple but flexible such that the user can have full control of the information.
• Users can see bills, debts, and payments with friends, including the ones added by their friends.
• Quick debt summary to see how much you owe others or who owes you money
• Synchronization of data across web and Android applications so that friends can see the transactions on their devices and know their liabilities quickly.
We want to build tools that are user-oriented, and that's why we love to hear from you. Email them to info@billsup.com.

Although the application is intended to be free, we will be serving ads to sustain the operational costs of running the website. We plan on setting up premium accounts that have access to ad-free versions of the website for a small monthly fee. As a ""lifetime premium account"" holder for supporting us in this campaign, you will get premium account status for free for the lifetime of the website.

When a new version or feature of the application is developed, we first release it to a limited number of people to try it out and give us feedback (if they want to) for a period of time, usually 1 to 3 weeks before the actual features are available to everyone. This period of time is called the private beta, and only certain people (we trust) gets to participate! In short, you get bragging rights to say ""first!"", and also we'll pay more attention to the  feedback of our private beta people!
How about other sites that manage bills/debts?

We plan to build a solution that's catered to the user's needs, including mobile and web application that works well together so that bills/debts can be managed anywhere. With your contributions, we can implement these features and port to more platforms faster - thanks!
We're two software engineering graduates with a passion to help people.
Anup found his passion for computers ever since he used Paint on Windows 3.1. He enjoys coding, and has experience as a software engineer in Infosys and SAP.

Caleb loves developing software and building start-ups from the ground up. He holds a masters in software systems, and a bachelors in Electrical and Computer Engineering, He has worked at Microsoft, SAP, MDA, Broadcom, and PMC Sierra.
","Hello, thanks for checking out our project :-)

Billsup is a simple tool to track debts and manage shared bills amongst friends. For this campaign, we are building its web application and its Android application, which will allow users to record bills, track payments and debts, and send a reminder to friends.

During college, Anup shared a house with a bunch of roommates. Between rent, daily expenses, and group trips, it became very difficult to keep track of I-owe-you's. Anup found that the existing tools and websites do not have the ease-of-use and flexibility that he wanted, so billsup is being built to help people like Anup - those who want an easy way to keep track of debt and shared bills with friends. Billsup came as a side project for us, and we're building it as a tool to help people like us.

Support us by funding to our project. Depending on how much you contribute, you can choose one of the different rewards at your pledge tier! :-) If you are outside of Canada or US, please add $5 to your pledge to account for shipping costs.
You could also pledge without picking a reward.
How about equity? Can I pledge for a share of the company?

I've been asked this question by multiple people - we really would appreciate your pldeges, but currently we are not considering distributing equity, unless your pledge amount exceeds $10,000 USD - if that's the case, contact us at info@billsup.com. Otherwise, you could still pledge any amount without picking a reward if you do not want any of the rewards.

Our goal of $3000 is actually a very small portion of our operational cost, so it'd be great if we can exceed our goal. The money we do collect will be going directly to making this project happen. So far, we've been using our own time to build the project, and spending our own funds to host the website and various other operations. With your contribution, we would be able to:
Buy more Android devices to test our application on different platforms
Spend more time building features that users want
Pay for part of our operation cost such as domain hosting, various development software and equipment
Plan and build the tool for other platforms

Even though this has been a side project, we're working hard on completing it, and will be spending a lot more time on it if the campaign is successful.  Our current plan is to complete the web application by the end of June, and the Android application by the end of July.
I'm not from US or Canada, can I still contribute?
Yes, you can contribute from anywhere in the world! Every bit helps, thanks so much for your support!
